0.title: Most young singers try to sound like Arijit, Atif: Amaal Mallik
0.article_body: Singer-composer Amaal Mallik has stated that most young singers nowadays "go nasal, gimmicky or try to sound like Arijit Singh or Atif Aslam". He further said that the correct pronunciation is a problem with most young singers and they are not clear with their Hindi like the older generation was. Amaal's single 'Chalo Theek Hai' was released recently.

1.title: My govt will complete its tenure, we'll even win next poll: Shinde
1.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Saturday said that his government will complete its tenure, adding, "We'll even win next election." While speaking at a press conference, he said that it is only the natural alliance of the BJP and Shiv Sena that can take Maharashtra ahead. Earlier today, BJP chief JP Nadda held a meeting with Shinde on cabinet expansion.

2.title: New warrant issued against Alt News' Zubair in UP's Lakhimpur Kheri
2.article_body: A court in Uttar Pradesh's Lakhimpur Kheri has issued a warrant summoning Alt News Co-founder Mohammed Zubair before it on July 11 in a case lodged last year for allegedly promoting enmity between two groups. This came hours after being granted bail by Supreme Court in a case registered against him in Sitapur, for allegedly calling three Hindu seers "hatemongers".

3.title: Police Inspector thrashes & rapes wife of former accused, kidnaps couple in Hyd
3.article_body: A police Inspector allegedly thrashed and raped the wife of a man whom he had arrested in the past and also kidnapped the couple in Telangana's Hyderabad, police said. Marredpally SHO Nageshwar Rao allegedly raped the woman in her house on July 7 and threatened the couple to leave Hyderabad. He later took them away in his car, police said.

4.title: Tsunami of unemployment has hit the nation under BJP's rule: Rahul
4.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Saturday took to Twitter and alleged, "Under the BJP's rule, the prices of domestic LPG cylinders went up by 157%, fuel prices broke all records and the 'Gabbar Tax loot' and a 'tsunami of unemployment' hit the country." "[Public] is telling PM Narendra Modi...these obstacles created by you have exhausted us, now stop," Gandhi added.

5.title: Farooq Abdullah demands probe in Amarnath cloudburst incident
5.article_body: J&K National Conference chief Farooq Abdullah has demanded an investigation into the Amarnath cloudburst incident, adding that the government should explain what happened and how. Calling the incident unfortunate, he said, "Basis on which tents were put up at such...risky place should be investigated. It's the first time when tents were placed there." Sixteen people have died in the incident.

6.title: Not ideal to have 7 captains in such short span of time, got to feel for Dravid: Ganguly
6.article_body: Talking about Team India, BCCI President Sourav Ganguly said it isn't ideal to have seven different captains in such a short span of time. "But it has happened because of an unavoidable situation," he added. "The calendar is such that we've had to give players breaks and then there have been injuries...You got to feel for Rahul Dravid," Ganguly stated.

7.title: Telangana govt starts 'Dalit Bandhu Scheme' to empower community
7.article_body: The Telangana government has distributed commercial vehicles to the Dalit community in Hyderabad under the 'Dalit Bandhu Scheme', which is aimed at empowering the community and lifting them out of poverty. "Dalit Bandhu is a unique scheme in which ₹10 lakh will be given to Dalit families. They can use this for doing business," an SC Corporation official said.

8.title: Thane elderly couple robbed of valuables worth ₹8 lakh at knifepoint
8.article_body: Police said that an elderly couple was robbed of valuables worth over ₹8.82 lakh by unidentified men who broke into their house in Thane. Four unidentified persons entered the house from the kitchen door and brandished a knife at 62-year-old Baban Kalu Mhatre and his wife, a police official said. A case has been registered under IPC section 392 (robbery).

9.title: Hyderabad man dies by suicide over debts due to online gambling
9.article_body: A 36-year-old man, Dattatreya, died by suicide on Friday in Hyderabad after being unable to repay loans worth ₹7 lakh. According to police, the deceased was addicted to online gambling for the last two years and raised loans from banks and other sources. Police found a suicide note at his residence, which said he was being harassed to repay loans.

10.title: Secularism in blood & veins of every individual in India: VP Naidu
10.article_body:
Vice President Venkaiah Naidu on Saturday said secularism is safe in India, not because of any government or political party, but because it's in the blood and veins of every individual living here. 
"Ours is a great country, fortunately India is again on the move, world is now recognising and respecting India once again, nobody can ignore us," Naidu said.

11.title: 20 take road trip from Pune to Hyd as flight cancelled last moment
11.article_body: Twenty people were reportedly forced to take the roadway to reach Hyderabad from Pune after their Alliance Air Pune-Hyderabad flight was cancelled at the last moment. "There was no assistance provided by Alliance Air...[It] was...very pathetic situation," a traveller said. The airline reportedly announced the flight cancellation when the passengers were waiting at the boarding gate at the airport.

12.title: 110 kg of marijuana worth ₹11 lakh seized in Thane, 1 arrested
12.article_body: Police on Friday said that they seized 110 kg of marijuana worth ₹11 lakh and arrested one person in Thane. Acting on a tip-off, Crime Unit V laid a trap near Kapurbawdi fire station around 9 pm on Thursday and intercepted a tempo, senior inspector Vikas Ghodke said. Police also seized the tempo and some cash from the accused.

13.title: GHMC imposes ₹120 cr fine on hoardings, collects ₹12 cr in Hyderabad
13.article_body: Three years after a ban was imposed on illegal hoardings in Hyderabad, the Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) imposed a penalty of ₹120 crore on violators, but has collected only ₹12 crore. "We had conducted a drive during April and issued 1,321 challans against printing agencies," a GHMC official said. The civic body has not taken action against the violators.

14.title: Nokia, IISc to set up robotics Center of Excellence in Bengaluru
14.article_body: Nokia and the Indian Institute of Science (IISc) have partnered to set up a Center of Excellence (CoE) in Bengaluru. The CoE will promote inter-disciplinary research in robotics and advanced communication technologies in 5G and Artificial Intelligence (AI), as per a joint statement. The CoE will also develop use cases across industrial automation, agriculture and disaster management, it added.

15.title: 12 students from Kerala arrested for selling ganja in Mangaluru
15.article_body: Police arrested 12 students, all residents of Kerala, studying in different private colleges across Mangaluru for allegedly possessing and selling ganja. They seized 900 grams of ganja worth ₹20,000, smoking pipes, rolling papers, ₹4,500 cash, 11 mobile phones and an electronic weighing machine from them. After a medical examination, 11 of the 12 accused were found positive for consuming drugs.

16.title: 78 kg garbage dropped from the space station for the first time, video released
16.article_body: The International Space Station (ISS) sustainably released around 172 pounds (78 kg) of waste using a first-of-its-kind specialised trash bag on July 2. The specialised bag has been developed by NASA's Johnson Space Center and Nanoracks and contains filthy garments, foam, packing materials, used office supplies, and hygiene items. The bag will burn up while re-entering Earth's atmosphere.

17.title: UP bride calls off wedding, says groom looked 'fair coloured in the photo'
17.article_body: A bride in Uttar Pradesh's Etawah called off her wedding, alleging that the groom looked fair coloured in the photograph that she was shown earlier. Her mother also claimed that everyone in her family was sure that the groom was not the man they had seen in photo. As the issue wasn't resolved, the groom's family had to return empty-handed.

18.title: It's a cause for worry: Sunil Gavaskar on India failing to defend 378
18.article_body: Ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar said India's failure to defend a 378-run target in the fifth Test against England is a "cause for worry". "They did it with so much time to spare...they got 120 runs in 100 minutes," added Gavaskar. "Maybe we didn't try different angles...maybe we could've made bowling changes...Every...time the batter seemed to have more determination," he stated.

19.title: Djokovic fears Kyrgios' unreadable serve: Ex-member of Serbian tennis team
19.article_body: Former member of the Serbian tennis team, Craig O'Shannessy, has said that 20-time Grand Slam champion Novak Djokovic "fears" the "unreadable" serve of Australia's Nick Kyrgios. "Novak fears that service game. He absolutely does and that's self-evident with Novak nominating Nick as the best serve he's played against," O'Shannessy said. The two players will meet in the Wimbledon final tomorrow.

20.title: We 'complied under protest' with govt's blocking orders: Twitter
20.article_body: Twitter "complied under protest" with the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology's (MeitY) recent orders to block 39 specific accounts, Moneycontrol reported citing a petition by the company in the Karnataka High Court. The petition said these orders were overbroad and disproportionate and did not meet the requirements of Section 69A of the Information Technology Act, 2000.

21.title: Broad would've attempted 6 each ball if Root or Bairstow got out: Anderson
21.article_body: Discussing England's win in the fifth Test against India, James Anderson said Stuart Broad was the next batter in case Jonny Bairstow or Joe Root got dismissed and would've attempted a six every ball. Bairstow and Root shared an unbeaten 269-run partnership as England chased down the 378-run target. "[Nobody was] padded up for the last 20 runs," added Anderson.

22.title: I'd do Jaya Prada's moves on 'Dafaliwale', dad never found it strange: Johar
22.article_body: Karan Johar said that his late father, producer Yash Johar, was a "very progressive thinking and a very open-hearted man". "He never made me feel like I was different from anybody else," Karan added. "I used to dance to 'Dafaliwale', he was so proud of it...[He] never...thought...it was strange that his eight-year-old son is dancing to...Jaya Prada's movements," he said.

23.title: Andhra CM Jagan Reddy elected as YSR Congress' lifetime President
23.article_body: Andhra Pradesh CM YS Jagan Mohan Reddy was elected as the lifetime President of his party, Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress (YSRC). The announcement was made on the concluding day of the YSRC's two-day plenary. Notably, the party's constitution was amended to enable CM Jagan for the post, especially after his mother, Vijayamma, had quit as YSRC's honorary President.

24.title: Vignesh Shivan shares unseen pics from wedding on 1 month anniversary
24.article_body: Director Vignesh Shivan took to Instagram on Saturday to share a post marking one month of his wedding with actress Nayanthara. He shared a series of unseen pictures, featuring Shah Rukh Khan, Rajinikanth, directors Atlee and Mani Ratnam. "Blessed to have this humble...and wonderful human being with us during our wedding," Vignesh wrote while sharing pictures with Shah Rukh.

25.title: As a tennis fan, I'm glad Kyrgios made it to Wimbledon final: Djokovic
25.article_body: Defending champion Novak Djokovic said it's surprising that world number 40 Nick Kyrgios has reached Wimbledon final because of his ranking. "As a tennis fan, I'm glad he made it to...final, he's very talented," he added. Kyrgios reached his maiden Grand Slam final after Rafael Nadal withdrew before their semi-final match. Djokovic will face unseeded Kyrgios in final on Sunday.

26.title: Bharat Alt Fuel to invest ₹250 crore to build EV plant in Tamil Nadu
26.article_body: Alternative fuel technology startup Bharat Alt Fuel has announced its plan to invest ₹250 crore to build a plant in Tamil Nadu that will produce electric vehicles, batteries and motors. The construction of the 40,000 square metres plant in Krishnagiri is expected to begin in Q4 of 2022-23. Initial production capacity will be 25,000 EVs, going up to 1,00,000 gradually.

27.title: Govt shows Meta's stall showcasing AR/VR tech at Digital India Week
27.article_body: The IT ministry took to Twitter to share a video of the stall of Facebook-parent Meta at the Digital India Week 2022. "They are showcasing how AR/VR technologies can be used across key sectors like skilling and education," the ministry said. Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated Digital India Week on July 4.

28.title: UP man who once worked as airport cleaner in Aus now millionaire CEO of IT firm
28.article_body: Aamir Qutub, a 33-year-old Indian-origin man who once worked as an airport cleaner in Australia, is now the millionaire CEO of IT firm Enterprise Monkey. Qutub told Daily Mail when he moved from Uttar Pradesh to Australia 10 years ago, he submitted 300 job applications but they were all rejected. "It was hard to find jobs without experience," he added.

29.title: Ronaldo leaving Man Utd is not about money: Ex-Arsenal defender
29.article_body: Former Arsenal defender Bacary Sagna has commented on the ongoing speculations of Portuguese footballer Cristiano Ronaldo leaving the Manchester United club in the coming weeks. "Ronaldo is a football lover...I'm sure he would have been disappointed with the season that Manchester United had...All he wants to do is play football. It has nothing to do with money," Sagna said.

30.title: Tripura to restart scheme to bring back students who dropped out
30.article_body: Tripura government will restart 'Vidyalaya Chalo Abhiyan' after school authorities reported that nearly 8,850 school students dropped out amid COVID-19, according to state Education Minister Ratan Lal Nath. The state government will also launch 'Earn with Learn' scheme for college students, wherein they will conduct surveys to identify dropouts and will be paid ₹500 for each re-admission.

31.title: Pune airport Director asks airlines to take care of flyers in rains
31.article_body: Amid heavy rains, Pune airport authorities have directed all airlines to take care of flyers. Pune airport Director Santosh Dhoke said, "We've instructed all airlines that during rains, they should use...aerobridge every time so that flyers don't face any problems." This comes after flyers complained about having to walk in the rain while boarding the Pune-Jaipur SpiceJet flight on Thursday.

32.title: Man breaking rules stabs policeman, drives car with him on bonnet in Mumbai
32.article_body: A car driver reportedly assaulted a policeman in Navi Mumbai's Kharghar. According to the Twitter user who shared video of the incident, the accused tried to flee the spot after breaking traffic rules. But when the policeman came in front of his car, he stabbed him and drove the car for about 500 metres with the policeman hanging on bonnet.

33.title: Kedarnath Yatra halted amid heavy rains to ensure pilgrims' safety
33.article_body: The Rudraprayag district administration in Uttarakhand on Saturday announced that the Kedarnath Yatra has been stopped in the wake of heavy rainfall from Sonprayag onwards. The district administration informed that the decision has been taken to ensure pilgrims' safety amid fears of untoward incidents. At least 16 people died after flash floods near Jammu and Kashmir's Amarnath cave on Friday.

34.title: Panasonic sues Broadcom for infringing its computer-technology patents
34.article_body: Japanese electronics maker Panasonic on Thursday sued chipmaker Broadcom for allegedly violating its rights in several computer-technology patents. In the lawsuit, Panasonic alleged that Broadcom's products including microprocessors, integrated circuits and components used in wireless networking infringe 10 of its patents. Panasonic has demanded an unspecified amount of money in damages.

35.title: Brazilian startup Creditas extends $260 mn funding round to buy bank
35.article_body: Brazilian fintech startup Creditas has announced a $50 million extension to its $260 million Series F financing round. As per a press release, the extension is helping the firm in buying the Brazilian banking license of Andorra-based Andbank, which will participate in the round. The license deal, reportedly worth $100 million, is yet to get approved by Brazil's central bank.

36.title: 2 from Raj arrested by B'luru Police for looting ₹1.58cr ornaments
36.article_body: Two individuals were arrested from Rajasthan by a Bengaluru Electronic City Police team for looting ornaments worth ₹1.58 crore at gunpoint from a jewellery shop in the city, officials said on Friday. The accused were arrested within 72 hours of the robbery, police said. Police added that the alleged robbers came into the shop posing as customers.

37.title: Sangakkara shares video of thousands protesting outside Presidential Secretariat in SL
37.article_body: Former Sri Lanka captain Kumar Sangakkara took to Twitter to share a video of thousands of people protesting outside the Presidential Secretariat in Sri Lanka's Colombo. "This is for our future," Sangakkara wrote alongside the video. Earlier today, the protesters also broke into the official residence of President Gotabaya Rajapaksa.

38.title: Shawn Mendes postpones 3 weeks of shows over mental health, shares note
38.article_body: Singer Shawn Mendes shared a note on Instagram on Friday writing that he is postponing three weeks of his 'Wonder: The World Tour' due to his mental health. He wrote, "I've been touring since I was 15...After a few years off the road, I was ready to dive back in but the decision was premature...and I've hit a breaking point."

39.title: Google proposes moving ad business to Alphabet to avoid lawsuit: Report
39.article_body: Google has offered to move its ad auctions business into a separate company under Alphabet to avoid a potential US antitrust lawsuit, reports stated. It is reportedly part of multiple concessions Google has offered the Department of Justice to avoid lawsuits alleging anti-competitive practices. The DoJ is reportedly preparing a lawsuit alleging Google's ad-tech practices are anti-competitive.

40.title: Man attacks wife, her family with swords, then kills self in Punjab
40.article_body: A man allegedly attacked his wife and four members of her family with swords at her house in Punjab's Moga on Saturday, then returned to his own house and died by suicide. The deceased's wife had started living separately after the couple had a dispute, SHO said. When the wife refused to return, the deceased attacked them, according to police.

41.title: Former SL cricket captain Jayasuriya joins protest against country's Prez, shares pics
41.article_body: Former Sri Lanka cricket captain Sanath Jayasuriya on Saturday joined the protest against Sri Lanka President Gotabaya Rajapaksa. "I always stand with the people of Sri Lanka. And will celebrate victory soon," he tweeted while sharing pictures. "The siege is over. Your bastion has fallen...Please have the dignity to resign now! #GoHomeGota," Jayasuriya wrote in another tweet.

42.title: Maharashtra man tears passport pages to hide Maldives trip with lover from wife; arrested
42.article_body: A Maharashtra man has been arrested for tearing the pages of his passport to hide Maldives trip with his lover from his wife. Immigration authorities handed him over to the police, who placed him under arrest on charges of cheating and forgery. The man told his wife that he was going on an official trip.

43.title: Never thought 'Teri Maa Ka Mukut' dialogue would become a craze: Shamshera maker
43.article_body: Director Karan Malhotra spoke about the viral 'Teri Maa Ka Mukut' dialogue mouthed by Sanjay Dutt in the trailer of 'Shamshera' and said he had never imagined the dialogue would become such a craze. "From the day the trailer released, the dialogue has been trending," he added. Karan further said the dialogue was not originally a part of the script.

44.title: Was told B'wood is the 'worst place', 'full of monsters, demons': Kubbra
44.article_body: Actress Kubbra Sait said in an interview that when she entered the film industry, she was told that it is full of "monsters and demons". "I was told...this is the worst place to be in and...I should just pack off and go," Kubbra said, adding, "But now when I look back, I couldn't have been in a more noble profession."

45.title: Might be a full stop: Finch hints on his possible retirement
45.article_body: Australian white-ball skipper Aaron Finch (35) has hinted at his possible retirement from cricket after this year's ICC T20 World Cup. "It might be a full stop on everything [several players retiring from T20Is, including him] if it goes to plan like that," Finch said. "When guys get to their mid-30s, it's going to be that way," he added.

46.title: Bank of Spain registers Binance as virtual asset services provider
46.article_body: Bank of Spain has registered world's largest crypto exchange Binance's local unit, Moon Tech Spain, as a virtual asset services provider. This enables the firm to offer its services in Spain in compliance with the bank's anti-money laundering and counter-terrorist financing rules, Binance said. The bank, however, clarified that the registration doesn't mean it approves the firm's activities.

47.title: Reach out to potential startups, support them: MoS to officials
47.article_body: Minister of State for Science and Technology Jitendra Singh on Friday urged government officials and agencies to reach out to potential startups and support them. This will ensure that startup initiatives that may not have taken off because of inadequate support or resources don't get left out, he added. Singh said budding startups are going to shape India's future economy.

48.title: Actress Kirsten Dunst marries Jesse Plemons after 6 years of dating
48.article_body: Actress Kirsten Dunst and actor Jesse Plemons recently got married after being together for six years, confirmed Kirsten's representative. The couple tied the knot at the GoldenEye resort in Jamaica's Ocho Rios. The 40-year-old actress got engaged to the 34-year-old actor in January 2017. The couple welcomed their first son in 2018 and their second son in 2021.

49.title: Tesla's new German plant to halt production for 2 weeks: Reports
49.article_body: Tesla's newly-opened Gigafactory near Berlin in Germany will stop production for two weeks starting July 11, according to media reports. The factory, which started production in March-end, will reportedly undergo maintenance work to shorten its manufacturing time. It produced 1,000 vehicles per week in June, around a tenth of what it aims to produce, German tabloid Bild reported.

50.title: Future wars are all about drones, crews of planes have no chance: Musk
50.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk in response to a video on drones said, "Future wars are all about the drones. Human crews of planes or tanks have no chance." The video showed a drone being piloted by "computer vision". However, Musk pointed out an exception to his proposition, saying, "A purely analogue, human-controlled vehicle is far more resilient to EMF weapons."

51.title: India's 1st e-waste eco-park to be built in Delhi's Holambi Kalan
51.article_body: Delhi Environment Minister Gopal Rai held a review meeting with officials of the Delhi Pollution Control Committee over the construction of India's first e-waste eco-park in the city. Rai said the park will be developed in Delhi's Holambi Kalan in an area of about 21 acres and will be completed in 23 months. It'll significantly reduce Delhi's pollution, he added.

52.title: Court dismisses bail plea of Delhi policeman held in kidnapping case
52.article_body: A Delhi court dismissed the bail plea of a Delhi policeman, held in a kidnapping case, on grounds of the "serious nature of the allegations and the gravity of offence". A youth was arrested and the accused demanded a ₹2 lakh ransom. The counsel for the accused claimed that his client has been falsely implicated in the case.

53.title: SP Founder Mulayam Singh Yadav's wife Sadhna Gupta passes away
53.article_body: Samajwadi Party (SP) Founder Mulayam Singh Yadav's wife Sadhna Gupta passed away at a hospital in Gurugram on Saturday. Gupta was reportedly admitted to Medanta hospital, where she was undergoing treatment for a lung disease. She had been ill for a long time and was in the ICU for the last four days, reports further stated.

54.title: No doubt he'll be aggressive: Djokovic on facing Kyrgios in Wimbledon final
54.article_body: Top seed Novak Djokovic said there is no doubt about unseeded Nick Kyrgios playing aggressively in Wimbledon final. "I expect him to do that," he added. "He plays lights-out every time he steps out onto the court. Just [has] a lot of power in his serve and his game," he further said. Kyrgios leads Djokovic 2-0 in their head-to-head.

55.title: 6 mowed down by loader in UP's Chitrakoot; CM Yogi announces ex gratia
55.article_body: Six people died after being mowed down by a loader in Uttar Pradesh's Chitrakoot on Saturday. The accident took place when the driver of the vehicle lost control and ran over people sitting on the footpath. CM Yogi Adityanath has announced an ex gratia of ₹2 lakh to the families of the deceased and ₹50,000 to the injured.

56.title: SP chief Akhilesh's uncle supports NDA prez nominee, calls Akhilesh 'immature'
56.article_body: SP chief Akhilesh Yadav's uncle Shivpal Yadav has declared support for NDA's presidential nominee Droupadi Murmu. Shivpal, who heads Pragatisheel Samajwadi Party-Lohia, announced his decision after attending a dinner hosted by UP CM Yogi Adityanath for Murmu. He said he wasn't invited to meet with the opposition's presidential nominee Yashwant Sinha and called Akhilesh "politically immature".

57.title: Tata Motors passenger vehicle range gets a price hike of 0.55%
57.article_body: Tata Motors has raised the prices of its passenger vehicle range with immediate effect in order to partially offset the impact of rising input costs. The price hike is fixed at 0.55% and will be levied across the models from today. The firm has already hiked the prices of its commercial vehicle range by 1.5%-2.5% from July.

58.title: CBI files charge-sheet in West Bengal's Hanskhali gang-rape case
58.article_body: CBI filed a charge-sheet against nine accused in connection with the Hanskhali gang-rape case in West Bengal's Nadia on April 4 during a birthday party at the house of a TMC panchayat official's son. "The minor was allegedly gang-raped by three accused after being intoxicated," CBI claimed. "It was also alleged...accused immediately took her dead body...cremated it," CBI added.

59.title: Over 30,000 houses damaged due to recent Assam floods: CM Sarma
59.article_body: As many as 30,000 to 40,000 houses were damaged in Assam due to the recent massive floods, CM Himanta Biswa Sarma said, while adding that he has sought an advance amount from the National Disaster Response Fund (NDRF) to help the affected people. Sarma said Union Home Minister Amit Shah has assured him that his request would be actively considered.

60.title: Cab driver runs over dog sleeping on roadside in B'luru; arrested
60.article_body: A cab driver was arrested for allegedly running his vehicle over a stray dog who was sleeping on the roadside in Bengaluru, police said on Saturday. While locals claimed that the accused had "deliberately" run over the dog, the accused had maintained that he did not notice the sleeping dog. The cab driver was arrested based on CCTV footage.

61.title: Pics of pregnant Alia Bhatt from sets of her H'wood debut with Gal Gadot surface
61.article_body: New pictures of Alia Bhatt shooting her Hollywood debut 'Heart of Stone' in Portugal have emerged online. She had earlier shared a picture with her co-star Gal Gadot on Instagram after wrapping up the project, which will also star Jamie Dornan. The actress is expecting her first child with actor-husband Ranbir Kapoor.

62.title: Salt and Pepper get each other out during T20 match in England, fans react
62.article_body: Essex's Michael Pepper and Lancashire's Phil Salt were involved in each other's dismissals during the T20 Blast quarter-final. Salt stumped Pepper, while Pepper was involved in a relay catch to dismiss Salt. "Reminds me of Mustard and Onions," a fan wrote referring to ex-England cricketers Phil Mustard and Graham Onions. "The game needed some spicing up," wrote another.

63.title: Ola cutting jobs, delays appraisals citing business restructuring: Report
63.article_body: Ola is cutting jobs and has deferred the performance appraisal for employees for the year as it aims at "leaner and consolidated teams" to keep its "strong profitability intact", as per a report. Ola's HR reportedly told employees, "We're working on the restructuring of some of our businesses." It is reported that as many as 500 employees could be fired.

64.title: There's lot of age-tagging in B'wood, you're too old or too young: Nimrat
64.article_body: Actress Nimrat Kaur has stated that there is a lot of age-tagging in the film industry, adding you are either considered too old or too young to be doing things. "Whether it's a man or woman, age is a very jaded way of looking at a person. I strongly believe that ageism is extremely outdated and unfashionable," the actress said.

65.title: 37-yr-old Faf is playing well; should be in T20 WC squad: Morkel
65.article_body: Former South African pacer Morne Morkel has said that ex-skipper Faf du Plessis (37) should be included in the South African squad for this year's T20 World Cup. "Faf is still playing well...he has done exceptionally well for RCB," Morkel said. "I honestly believe that South Africa have an attack that is going to suit Australian conditions well," Morkel added.

66.title: Delhi launches 'Paryavaran Mitra' campaign to improve environment
66.article_body: Delhi government has launched a 'Paryavaran Mitra' campaign to improve the city's environment. Under the campaign, the government will register people working or willing to work for environmental protection as 'Paryavaran Mitra' and form ward-level teams,  Environment Minister Gopal Rai said. Notably, 1,742 volunteers registered themselves as 'Paryavaran Mitras' within a day of its launch.

67.title: Assam floods death toll reaches 190; over 8.88 lakh people still affected
67.article_body: The total death toll due to Assam floods and landslides has risen to 190, the Assam State Disaster Management Authority (ASDMA) said. This comes after two persons, including a child, died in flood waters and another person died in a landslide. More than 8.88 lakh people continue to be impacted with 620 villages still under the impact of floods.

68.title: Amarnath flash floods may be due to highly-localised rain event: IMD
68.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has said that the recent deaths and destruction near Amarnath cave in Jammu and Kashmir were due to a highly-localised rain event and not due to a cloudburst. According to weather scientists, the shrine reported 31 mm of rainfall from 4.30-6.30 pm on Friday, which is quite low to be categorised as a cloudburst.

69.title: Protestors swim in Presidential palace's pool in Sri Lanka after President runs away
69.article_body: A video showing protestors swimming in Sri Lanka Presidential palace's pool has gone viral on social media. Earlier, reports said that President Gotabaya Rajapaksa ran away after the protestors surrounded the palace. Meanwhile, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe has summoned an urgent cabinet meeting and has also requested the Speaker to summon the Parliament.

70.title: Google removes 4 apps from Play Store after Joker malware detected
70.article_body: Google has removed four apps from Play Store that were found to be infected with 'Joker' malware. Cybersecurity company Pradeo had issued a warning about these apps, saying they could be used to commit fraud through in-app purchases, calls or text messages. The four banned apps are Smart SMS Messages, Blood Pressure Monitor, Voice Languages Translator and Quick Text SMS.

71.title: I don't focus on speed: Ferguson on clocking the fastest ball of IPL 2022
71.article_body: Talking about bowling the fastest delivery of the IPL 2022, GT pacer Lockie Ferguson said he doesn't focus on the speed during the game. "It's never really a thought and...there are so many other thoughts around scouting, the batter I'm bowling to and what I'm trying to achieve with that ball," he added. Ferguson clocked 157.3 kmph in the final.

72.title: No matter what, if Kohli is available he'll play: Ishant on 2nd T20I
72.article_body: Amid talks over Virat Kohli's spot in the T20I side, considering the criticism over his low strike rate, pacer Ishant Sharma said Kohli will play in the second T20I against England if he's available. "It'll be hard on Deepak Hooda because Kohli will [bat at number three]," added Ishant. Kohli is a part of the squad for the remaining T20Is.

73.title: Woman, her lover arrested for plotting her father's murder in Raj
73.article_body: After a 47-year-old man was beaten to death in Rajasthan's Kota, police arrested his daughter and her lover for allegedly plotting to kill him and hiring five people for ₹50,000 to do it. During interrogation, it was revealed that the daughter was fed up with her alcoholic father, who had a heavy debt. The father's murder took place in June.

74.title: Was scared, thought I'd collapse: Sargun on shooting for B'wood debut film
74.article_body: Actress Sargun Mehta, speaking about shooting for her Bollywood debut film 'Mission Cinderella' which also stars Akshay Kumar, said that she was very scared initially. "Everything was giving me...jitters and I can't...begin to tell you how I gave my first shot," Sargun said, adding, "I thought I'd collapse...It was a...tough role and I was thinking about how I'd do it."

75.title: Illegal casino busted in Noida; 10 including 4 Nepalese nationals arrested
75.article_body: Noida Police on Friday reportedly busted an illegal casino set up inside a flat at a housing society in Greater Noida and arrested 10 people, including four Nepalese nationals. "Over ₹1 lakh cash...liquor bottles among other items were seized," a police officer said. Moreover, three decks of cards, two casino tables and 3,145 coins were also seized from the spot.

76.title: End of season 1, what a cliffhanger: Twitter staff after Musk ends $44 bn deal
76.article_body: Reacting to Tesla CEO Elon Musk terminating the $44 billion Twitter deal, an employee at the social media company said, "I just don’t believe it’s actually over." Meanwhile, Amir Shevat, another Twitter employee wrote, "End of season one- what a cliffhanger." Other staff members shared memes, such as that of a rollercoaster ride and a baby screaming into a phone.

77.title: Everyone is doing it in Bandstand: Esha on being criticised for intimate scenes
77.article_body: Actress Esha Gupta in an interview opened up about being criticised for her intimate scenes with Bobby Deol in the web series 'Aashram 3'. "The problem is, till now in India, they think...doing intimate scenes is such a big deal, where you go in Bandstand (Mumbai) everyone is...doing it," she said, adding, "It's sad that it is all...people talk about."

78.title: Shinzo Abe's assassination videos being removed by Twitter, Meta
78.article_body: Former Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe's assassination videos are being removed by Twitter and Meta from their platforms. Meta said it was deleting videos depicting the moment of the attack and had disabled the suspect's Facebook and Instagram accounts. Twitter said its teams are addressing "harmful content" relating to the attack by "proactively removing" material that violates its rules.

79.title: Footage shows Russian tanks blowing up in seconds after Ukraine's airstrikes
79.article_body: Ukraine said its airborne force destroyed nine Russian tanks as their Defence Ministry shared a footage showing thick smoke rising from tanks after explosions. "Total number of the enemy's tanks destroyed will soon reach 2,000," tweeted Ukraine's Defence Ministry while sharing the video that shows the tanks blowing up in seconds. It's not clear which region the footage is from.

80.title: Petrol will vanish from India after 5 years: Nitin Gadkari
80.article_body: Road Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari has said that petrol will vanish from the country after five years. He added, "Your cars and scooters will either be on green hydrogen, ethanol flex fuel, CNG or LNG." Earlier, Gadkari had said the government is promoting ethanol produced from crop residue as an alternative for petrol and diesel.

81.title: It's not like I had kids because I didn't have love: Karan on fatherhood
81.article_body: Speaking about being a single parent, filmmaker Karan Johar said that it's not like he had kids because he didn't have love in his life. "You'll know you want to be a parent when you're emotionally ready," he added. The filmmaker further said that many people thought parenthood was too much for him to handle because of his schedule.

82.title: Pune man tears passport pages to hide travel history from wife; held
82.article_body: A Pune-based 32-year-old man was stopped from boarding a flight to the Maldives and was arrested after officials at Mumbai International Airport found that he had reportedly torn about ten pages from his passport. According to the FIR, the man tore the pages to hide his travel history to Thailand from his wife. However, he was later released on bail.

83.title: Pune Metro extends deadline for Shivajinagar stretch to October
83.article_body: Officials of Maha Metro, which is implementing the Pune Metro Rail project, have said that they now expect to run Pune Metro up to Shivajinagar by October. This comes after officials in March had said that they were confident of running the service up to Shivajinagar from June. Officials have attributed the delay to "some hurdles".

84.title: Bengaluru police recover 5.11 kg marijuana, arrest 2 persons
84.article_body: Bengaluru's Upparpete police have arrested two persons who were allegedly involved in selling marijuana and recovered 5.11 kg of the drug, the city's DCP (West Division) Laxman B Nimbargi tweeted on Saturday. The arrests were made after the police raided the accused based on information received by them. Earlier on Thursday, the police had seized drugs worth ₹80 lakh.

85.title: You can tell actor's talent by eyes, can see party is empty: Divyenndu
85.article_body: Actor Divyenndu Sharma stated in an interview that an actor's talent can be seen in their eyes. "You can tell looking into their eyes that the party is empty, they are lost and their eyes are empty," he added. The actor further said that looking at such actors' eyes, he feels that luck plays a big role in the industry.

86.title: Wrong juror sat in Depp defamation trial, new trial should be ordered: Heard
86.article_body: Actress Amber Heard's team has stated that the verdict in the defamation trial by ex-husband Johnny Depp should be dismissed and a new trial should be ordered. They claimed a 77-year-old individual was called for duty, however, a 52-year-old with the same surname sat through the trial. The two individuals appear to live at the same address, the team stated.

87.title: Crash involving Cruise's self-driving car under probe in US
87.article_body: The US NHTSA has opened a special investigation into a recent crash involving a Cruise self-driving vehicle in California that resulted in minor injuries. The agency, however, has not specified the crash it is looking into. A Cruise car operating in driverless autonomous mode was reportedly involved in a crash on June 3 in San Francisco.

88.title: 2 arrested for assault in Faridabad after victim comes out of coma
88.article_body: Two people were held for assaulting and robbing a software engineer in Faridabad. The victim, Inder Singh (21), went into a 26-days-long coma after the assault and the arrest happened only after he narrated the incident, police said. One of the accused, Ritik Singh (21), started robbing to make up for ₹16 lakh he had stolen from his family.

89.title: India recorded highest-ever defence exports worth ₹13,000 cr in 2021-22: Govt
89.article_body: India's defence exports touched a record high of ₹13,000 crore in 2021-2022, the government said, adding that 70% contribution to the exports came from the private sector. Additional Secretary (Defence Production) Sanjay Jaju also said that the public sector accounted for the remaining 30% of India's defence exports. Defence exports increased by eight times in five years, said Jaju.

90.title: IMD issues red alert for Telangana for 2 days amid heavy rains
90.article_body: India Meteorological Department (IMD) issued a red alert for several parts of Telangana for Saturday and Sunday amid heavy rains. "Heavy to very heavy and extremely heavy rainfall of up to 20 cm...likely in the northern districts for two days," an official said. Nandipet in Nizamabad received about 20 cm of rainfall, the highest in Telangana, as of Saturday morning.

91.title: iD Fresh Food grants ESOPs worth ₹46 cr to 27 employees, including driver, helper
91.article_body: Ready-to-make packaged food startup iD Fresh Food has announced its seventh round of employee stock option plan (ESOP) tranche for its 27 employees. The  Bengaluru-based startup has granted ESOPs worth ₹46 crore to employees in the current round, including two who serve the company as driver and helper. "Our aspiration is to help create...100 crorepatis in...three years," the startup said.

92.title: 17-yr-old Pune girl falls to death from balcony of 14th-floor flat
92.article_body: A 17-year-old girl died after falling off the balcony of her 14th-floor flat in Hadapsar area of Pune, police said. The incident appeared to be a case of suicide after a preliminary probe, police added. "The reason is not clear and no suicide note has been found...She was alone at home at the time of death," an officer said.

93.title: Hindu outfits hold 'Sankalp March' in Delhi, traffic advisory issued
93.article_body: Delhi Traffic Police has issued an advisory in view of a 'Sankalp March' organised by various Hindu outfits on Saturday, against "attacks on the community". Several roads in central Delhi have been closed temporarily due to the march, reports stated. To facilitate smooth flow of traffic, only pedestrians have been allowed on at least nine important roads till 2 pm.

94.title: I'm worried about it: Manjrekar on Hardik bowling 10 overs in ODIs
94.article_body: Ex-India batter Sanjay Manjrekar said he is "worried" about Hardik Pandya bowling 10 overs in ODIs. "[ODI] cricket for an all-rounder is tough, it really takes a lot out of you...It is physically very draining," added Manjrekar. "Kapil Dev...[would]...confess that...[batting] first...[running] those hard singles and...then [coming] in to bowl another spell...was a very demanding task," he stated.

95.title: BJP wants to finish Shiv Sena: Sanjay Raut
95.article_body: Shiv Sena's Member of Parliament (MP) Sanjay Raut on Friday accused the BJP of trying to destroy Shiv Sena. "BJP doesn't want to engineer a split in the Shiv Sena, but it wants to finish the party," he said. "Till the time Shiv Sena exists, they cannot realise their dream of breaking Maharashtra into three pieces," he added.

96.title: Protestors enter Sri Lanka Presidential palace amid economic crisis; video surfaces
96.article_body: Protestors in Sri Lanka's commercial capital Colombo broke through police barricades and entered the Presidential palace on Saturday in one of the largest anti-government marches in the crisis-hit country this year. Reports earlier said that President Gotabaya Rajapaksa ran away after the protestors surrounded the palace. At least 21 people, including two policemen were injured and hospitalised.

97.title: 'Goodfellas', 'The Sopranos' actor Tony Sirico passes away at 79
97.article_body: Veteran American actor Tony Sirico, known for playing Paulie Walnuts in 'The Sopranos' and Tony Stacks in 'Goodfellas', passed away aged 79 on Friday. Sirico died at an assisted living facility in Fort Lauderdale, Florida, said his manager, Bob McGowen. Michael Imperioli, who portrayed Christopher Moltisanti on 'The Sopranos', mourned Sirico's demise, saying he will miss him forever.

98.title: Protesters ram tractor into barricades in H'yana; farmer killed, 4 hurt
98.article_body: A farmer was killed and four others, including three policemen, were injured after protesters allegedly rammed a tractor into the barricades outside Rajiv Gandhi Thermal Power Plant in Haryana's Hisar. The protesters, who've been staging a dharna for several weeks, demanded that the power plant shouldn't auction the fly ash it generates but rather give it to them as before.

99.title: Anthony Mackie-starrer 'Captain America 4' to be helmed by Julius Onah
99.article_body: The upcoming Anthony Mackie-starrer 'Captain America 4' will be directed by Julius Onah, known for 'The Girl is in Trouble' and 'The Cloverfield Paradox'. Malcolm Spellman, writer of 'The Falcon and the Winter Soldier', is writing the screenplay with Dalan Musson. Marvel Studios is expected to announce the release date of 'Captain America 4' at San Diego Comic-Con this month.

100.title: It wasn't pleasant to see the whole stadium cheering for Norrie: Novak
100.article_body: Discussing his win against Cameron Norrie in the Wimbledon 2022 men's singles semi-final, Novak Djokovic said, "It's never pleasant to have the whole stadium cheering for your opponent." "I sat down, wasn't...feeling well, but somehow...managed to turn the match around....It was not easy to close out the match...I felt a lot of pressure to serve it out," he added.

101.title: WWE founder paid ₹95 cr to 4 women to keep quiet about his sexual misconduct: Reports
101.article_body: WWE founder Vince McMahon paid more than $12 million (over ₹95 crore) to four different women to suppress allegations of sexual misconduct and infidelity, reports stated. One of the four women was an ex-WWE wrestler, who alleged that McMahon had coerced her into giving him oral sex and then demoted her, the reports added. WWE's board is investigating the allegations.

102.title: I am the outcast among Australian players: Wimbledon finalist Kyrgios
102.article_body: Australian tennis player Nick Kyrgios, who's reached the final of Wimbledon 2022, said he is the outcast among the Australian tennis players. "The...only great [Australian tennis player who's]...ever been supportive...[is] Lleyton Hewitt," added Kyrgios. Talking about being termed Wimbledon's "worst nightmare" in an article, Kyrgios stated, "It's hard. It's something that I have to deal with."

103.title: Govt standing behind private sector as partner in progress: PM Modi
103.article_body: Speaking at the first 'Arun Jaitley Memorial Lecture' in Delhi, PM Narendra Modi said that the government is standing behind the private sector as a partner in progress. "Today, India is one of the most reliable and state-of-the-art space service providers in the world. Our private sector ecosystem is doing a great job in this area," PM Modi added.

104.title: I am only as old as you think I am: Mahindra after Twitter user asks his age
104.article_body: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra on Saturday responded to a Twitter user who asked him his age. Mahindra wrote, "You could've found out via Google, so I suppose this is a philosophical question. In that spirit, my answer is that 'Age (like beauty) lies in the eyes of the beholder', so I'm only as old as you think I am."

105.title: Delhi man dies after assault; 1 killed in encounter; 3 arrested
105.article_body: A Delhi resident succumbed to his injuries sustained during an attack by five-six people in the city. The police arrested three people while one of the accused, Aakash (23), was shot dead during an encounter with the police in Delhi's New Usmanpur area. The other accused are identified as Vishal Negi (25), Monu (20) and Nikhil Dutt (19), police said.

106.title: Man arrested for smuggling gold worth ₹1.2 cr in suitcase rods in Hyderabad
106.article_body: A male passenger arriving from Dubai was arrested by customs officials at Rajiv Gandhi International Airport in Hyderabad for allegedly smuggling gold worth ₹1.2 crore. According to officials, the accused tried to smuggle 2,290 grams of gold by concealing it in his suitcase's rods. He was arrested on Friday and sent to judicial custody.

107.title: Sri Lanka President runs away as protestors surround his residence: Reports
107.article_body: Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa ran away after protestors surrounded his residence amid the economic crisis in the country. Protestors are demanding the resignation of Rajapaksa. Troops used tear gas and water cannons to push back demonstrators who breached the security barricades near the Presidential palace in the capital Colombo.

108.title: 4 arrested for robbing ₹56,000 from financial company in Delhi
108.article_body: Police arrested four men for allegedly robbing ₹56,000 from a non-banking financial company in Delhi's Preet Vihar area, police said. The accused also tried to rob gold articles but the branch manager pressed the security remote, which was kept in his pocket, police added. The accused fled from the spot after the security alarm started ringing loudly, police further said.

109.title: Rajnath Singh to launch 75 newly-made AI-enabled defence products
109.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh will inaugurate the first-ever 'Artificial Intelligence in Defence' symposium and exhibition, by the Department of Defence Production, Ministry of Defence, on July 11. He will be launching 75 newly-developed defence products powered by AI at the event. The products are in the domains of robotics systems, intelligent monitoring system and cybersecurity, among others.

110.title: India to tour Aus twice in 2024-32 FTP cycle; Tests increased to 5: Reports
110.article_body: The Indian cricket team is reportedly going to tour Australia twice in the upcoming 2024-2032 Future Tours Programme (FTP) cycle. According to reports, a five-match Test series will be held between the two nations in Australia instead of four. Notably, the reports claimed that Cricket Australia is expected to earn up to AU$300 million with the increase in matches.

111.title: Question is who'll Pant replace? Kishan or Karthik?: RP Singh on 2nd T20I
111.article_body: Discussing India's lineup for the second T20I against England, ex-India pacer RP Singh said, "The question is who'll Rishabh Pant replace? Ishan Kishan or Dinesh Karthik?" Virat Kohli, Jasprit Bumrah, Ravindra Jadeja and Pant didn't feature in the opening T20I but will be available for the remaining T20Is. However, Zaheer Khan said he doesn't expect any changes in the lineup.

112.title: US Senator Warren calls for universal device chargers to reduce e-waste
112.article_body: US Senator Elizabeth Warren called for US to follow EU in standardising universal chargers for devices to reduce e-waste. In a letter to US' Commerce Secretary Gina Raimondo, Warren and two other senators highlighted how chargers account for 11,000 tons of e-waste annually. "We can clear things up with uniform standards...for less expense, less hassle, and less waste," Warren tweeted.

113.title: 35-yr-old man lynched for allegedly stealing iron rods in Odisha
113.article_body: A 35-year-old man was allegedly lynched for stealing iron rods from a villager's prawn enclosure in Odisha's Balasore. According to police, the deceased had admitted to the theft when confronted and begged forgiveness. He had also returned the stolen rods to the owner. But he was tied to a tree in kangaroo court headed by the village sarpanch and assaulted.

114.title: Rohini Bhatia, wife of IndiGo Co-founder Rahul Bhatia, quits board
114.article_body: InterGlobe Aviation, the operator of IndiGo airline, said that Rohini Bhatia will resign from the board of directors of the company, with effect from July 11, 2022. Rohini is the wife of IndiGo Co-founder Rahul Bhatia and she is the Chairperson of the CSR committee of the company.  She had joined the board in 2019.

115.title: Ford recalls 100,000 vehicles in US over potential fire hazard
115.article_body: Automobile manufacturer Ford has recalled 100,000 vehicles in the US over potential fire risks. The recall covers certain 2020-2022 units of Ford Escape, Maverick and Lincoln Corsair with hybrid engines that can catch fire in case of an engine failure, the company said. However, it added that the issue has caused no accidents or injuries so far.

116.title: SBI to open 1st exclusive branch for start-ups in Bengaluru
116.article_body: The State Bank of India (SBI) and Karnataka Digital Economy Mission (KDEM) have signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU), which would enable SBI to open India's first dedicated branch for startups. The facility called the 'SBI Startup Hub' branch will be located at Koramangala in Bengaluru. SBI will offer collateral-free financial assistance of up to ₹2 crore to start-up entrepreneurs.

117.title: 3 minor boys gangrape 15-year-old girl in Tamil Nadu, blackmail her with video
117.article_body: The police in Tamil Nadu's Cuddalore has taken three minor boys into custody and booked them under POCSO Act for allegedly gangraping a 15-year-old girl. The accused also filmed the act on their mobile phones and threatened to circulate the clip if she revealed the incident to anyone. As per police, the juveniles circulated the clip to the victim's friend.

118.title: TIME magazine cover features Shinzo Abe
118.article_body: TIME magazine has unveiled the cover of its upcoming edition featuring former Japan PM Shinzo Abe who was assassinated during a speech in the Nara city. "Abe will be remembered for remaking Japan," TIME magazine said. After he was declared dead, medical officials said Abe was bleeding profusely and doctors couldn't stop the bleeding.

119.title: Adani Group to participate in 5G spectrum auction; to face Jio, Airtel: Report
119.article_body: The Adani Group has reportedly applied for participating in India’s first auction of 5G airwaves starting July 26. Three telecom operators- Reliance Jio, Bharti Airtel and Vodafone Idea have submitted their applications while Adani's participation is yet to be independently confirmed. A total of 72,097.85 MHz of spectrum worth at least ₹4.3 lakh crore will be put for auction.

120.title: It was unfair, strange: Ribéry on Ronaldo winning 2013 Ballon d'Or over him
120.article_body: Talking about Cristiano Ronaldo winning the Ballon d'Or in 2013 with him finishing third, French winger Franck Ribéry said, "It was unfair...I [should've] won it." "They extended the time for votes and something strange happened...It was a political choice," added Ribéry. "It was a difficult period, it was incomprehensible...For me, it was like a robbery," Ribéry had earlier stated.

121.title: Fire brigade rescues 6 people after part of house collapses in Pune
121.article_body: Fire brigade personnel rescued six residents of Karande Wada in Pune's Shukrawar Peth after a portion of a house collapsed on Saturday. A fire officer said that the structure is "80 to 90 years old", adding, "We suspect that incessant rains and...already dilapidated condition led to...collapse of this part." PMC's building department will inspect the structure, fire brigade officials said.

122.title: Red alert issued for 7 districts in K'taka amid heavy rains; 12 dead since June 1
122.article_body: Amid heavy rains, India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a red alert for Karnataka's Dakshina Kannada, Uttara Kannada, Udupi, Chikkamagaluru, Shivamogga, Kodagu and Hassan districts. CM Basavaraj Bommai on Friday said a total of 12 people have lost their lives so far in various rain-related incidents since June 1. Karnataka has received 94% excess rain during July, according to IMD.

123.title: Be careful about period-tracking apps: WH official after abortion ruling
123.article_body: Director of the White House's Gender Policy Council Jen Klein has said that people in the US should be "really careful" about using period-tracking apps following the Supreme Court's latest ruling on abortion. She clarified the White House is not directing people to stop using the apps. Menstrual cycle tracking app Flo announced an 'anonymous mode' option last week.

124.title: It's very emotional for me: Ananya on Suhana & Shanaya's acting debuts
124.article_body: Actress Ananya Panday has said she's looking forward to seeing her best friends Shanaya Kapoor and Suhana Khan make their debut in Bollywood. "Suhana, Shanaya and I have had this collective dream of being in showbiz. Growing up, all we did together was play acting games," Ananya said, adding, "So it's very exciting for me, it's very emotional for me."

125.title: 70-yr-old woman held captive by son in bathroom for 2 yrs in K'taka, freed
125.article_body: A 70-year-old woman, who had been held captive by her son and daughter-in-law in a bathroom at their home for over two years in Karnataka's Dakshina Kannada, has been freed, as per reports. The woman fell and was injured in January 2020, following which she was held captive and was not even provided food, a Senior Citizens' Helpline official said.

126.title: Steve Smith is a 'very harsh' critic of himself: Marnus Labuschagne
126.article_body: Australia batter Marnus Labuschagne said Steve Smith is a "very harsh" critic of himself, adding that Smith's expectations are "really high". Smith once ran three kilometres back to the hotel after being dismissed cheaply. "I always punish myself when I get no runs," he had stated. Smith recently scored his 28th Test century marking his first ton in 18 months.

127.title: After being acquitted of murder, BJP leader holds roadshow in UP; booked
127.article_body: A BJP leader and his supporters were booked for allegedly holding a roadshow from Etah district jail to Aligarh in Uttar Pradesh without administration's permission. The roadshow was taken out on Thursday, a day after the BJP leader was acquitted of murdering a man during 2020 CAA-NRC protest. "There were around 30 to 35 vehicles in...procession," a police officer said.

128.title: India responded after Chinese jet came close to LAC in June: Reports
128.article_body: The Indian Air Force had responded as per the standard operating procedures after Chinese Air Force aircraft flew very close to the Line of Actual Control (LAC) in Ladakh sector in the last week of June, reports said. The aircraft was spotted by men on ground and was also picked up by radars deployed in the border area, reports added.

129.title: Sale of machine made or polyester national flag exempt from GST: Govt
129.article_body: The Finance Ministry has clarified that the sale of India's national flag, irrespective of whether it is machine-made or of polyester, is exempt from GST. Hand-woven, hand-spun national flags made of cotton, silk, wool or Khadi are already exempt from GST. After an amendment to the Flag Code of India, 2002, the tricolour can now be hand-made or machine-made.

130.title: If a top 5 batter bowls in powerplay, it's like having 12 players: Parthiv
130.article_body: Ex-India wicketkeeper Parthiv Patel said he feels that a team is playing with 12 players if there's a batter in the top five who can bowl in the powerplay. Hardik Pandya recently picked four wickets in the first T20I against England. Bhuvneshwar Kumar conceded 10 runs and picked one wicket. "When there's swing...there is none better than Bhuvneshwar," added Parthiv.

131.title: A stampede-like situation happened: Rescued Amarnath pilgrim on cloudburst
131.article_body: "A stampede-like situation happened there," said a pilgrim who was rescued from the Amarnath cave following a cloudburst. "The floods triggered by the cloudburst carried a large number of stones with it," an eyewitness said. "We all had a harrowing experience as we witnessed people and bags get swept away with the water," another rescued pilgrim added.

132.title: Boris Johnson's wax statue placed outside 'find a job' centre after he resigns as UK PM
132.article_body: A wax figure of Boris Johnson has appeared outside a 'find a job' centre after he resigned as the UK PM. Members of the public have been spotted posing for photos with the waxwork, from Madame Tussauds in Blackpool. Johnson will continue to serve as Prime Minister until the Conservative Party chooses his successor.

133.title: Messi threatens to leave PSG if the club signs Ronaldo: Reports
133.article_body: PSG forward Lionel Messi has threatened to leave PSG if the club signs Cristiano Ronaldo from Manchester United, reports stated. Messi reportedly told PSG President Nasser Al-Khelaifi that he'll return to Barcelona in case the club signs Ronaldo. Ronaldo is believed to be looking for transfer from Manchester United as the club failed to qualify for the upcoming Champions League.

134.title: US President pens note for Shinzo Abe at Japan embassy; pic surfaces
134.article_body: US President Joe Biden visited Japanese Ambassador to the US, Koji Tomita, and offered his condolences after the assassination of Shinzo Abe. Biden penned a note for the former Japanese PM and wrote, "I had the honour to get to know Abe when I hosted him at the Vice President's residence and when I met with him in Japan."

135.title: I've more tolerance for bullshit now: Taapsee on completing 12 yrs in industry
135.article_body: Actress Taapsee Pannu, who has completed 12 years in the industry, spoke about how she has changed over the years and said that she has become a very different person from what she was in the beginning. She added that she has "a lot more tolerance for bullshit now". "I've...calmed down a lot from what I was before," said Taapsee.

136.title: Musical.ly co-founder quits TikTok-parent ByteDance: Report
136.article_body: Lip-sync video app Musical.ly Co-founder Louis Yang left China's ByteDance last week following the failure of an edtech project due to a regulatory crackdown on online tutoring services and apps, Bloomberg reported citing a source. Yang was last in charge of ByteDance's foray into educational gadgets. Musical.ly was acquired by ByteDance and got absorbed into TikTok.

137.title: 23-year-old man killed following verbal spat in Pune; 4 arrested
137.article_body: Four people were arrested for allegedly killing a 23-year-old man following a verbal spat with one of them in Pune, according to police. One of the accused had reportedly knifed the deceased in the stomach. The deceased had also called his friends and had been searching for one of the accused with the intention of physical assault.

138.title: Uttarakhand HC permits animal slaughter on Bakri Eid in Haridwar
138.article_body: Uttarakhand High Court on Thursday permitted animal slaughter in Haridwar district during the Bakri Eid festival. HC directed that the animals should be slaughtered only at a "legally compliant" slaughterhouse and not on roads. The state government, in March 2021, had imposed a blanket ban on all animal slaughter in Haridwar ahead of the Kumbh Mela.

139.title: Shoppers Stop announces flat 50% off on over 500 brands
139.article_body: Shoppers Stop, a fashion & beauty destination has announced flat 50% off on over 500 brands. Revamp your wardrobe with stylish options available at great deals across categories like watches, fragrances, apparel, footwear and more, the brand stated. Additionally, users of HDFC Bank cards and First Citizen Citibank credit cards can avail up to 10% instant discount* and 10% cashback*.

140.title: Planning to increase childcare benefits at my firms: Elon Musk
140.article_body: The world’s richest person Elon Musk on Friday said that he plans to "significantly" increase childcare benefits at his companies. Musk, who is now a father of nine children, while replying to a tweet seeking advice to those who don't have children "for cost reasons", said, "Kids are worth it...Also, Musk Foundation plans to donate directly to families."

141.title: Teen kills 80-yr-old grandmother for not giving him money in Delhi
141.article_body: A 17-year-old boy reportedly killed his 80-year-old grandmother in Delhi's Shalimar Bagh area for not giving him money. According to police, the accused entered the flat where the deceased had been living alone for over a year on Thursday. He demanded money from her and when she refused, he slit her throat using a blade, police said.

142.title: Rogers network recovering after 19-hr outage hits millions in Canada
142.article_body: Canadian telecom provider Rogers' network has started recovering after it suffered a major 19-hour service outage that affected millions in Canada. The outage affected banking services, internet access, cell phone and landline phone connections, with some people reporting not being able to connect to 911 calls. Rogers CEO Tony Staffieri apologised for the outage, saying, "Today we let you down."

143.title: Sachin Pilot meets family of tailor killed in Udaipur; shares pics
143.article_body: Congress leader Sachin Pilot on Friday met the family members of tailor Kanhaiya Lal, who was beheaded in Udaipur for allegedly supporting suspended BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma. He also shared pictures of the meeting. Calling the incident a "barbaric massacre", he added that the "pain and anguish" that Kanhaiya's family is going through can't be expressed in words.

144.title: Picking Bumrah as captain for 5th Test was the biggest mistake: Ghavri
144.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Karsan Ghavri said the BCCI made their "biggest mistake" by picking Jasprit Bumrah as captain for the fifth Test against England. Ghavri added that Virat Kohli should have led the team. "Batting, bowling, bowling changes, fielding and field placement – everything was a concern," stated Ghavri. He said the decision to not pick Ravichandran Ashwin was "totally wrong".

145.title: Alt News was only enabled to receive domestic payments: Razorpay
145.article_body: Razorpay CEO Harshil Mathur released a statement in connection with donations received by Alt News. While the Delhi Police alleged that Alt News Co-founder Mohammed Zubair received donations from foreign nations, Mathur stated that only domestic payments were enabled for them and foreign transactions weren't allowed without FCRA approval. Razorpay temporarily disabled their account, he added.

146.title: Over 72,000 startups have created 7.5 lakh jobs in India: Govt data
146.article_body: The latest data released by the Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade (DPIIT) showed that the number of officially recognised startups in India has risen to 72,000, and they have also created 7.5 lakh jobs in the country. Out of these, over 45% have at least one woman director. Around 11 jobs were created by each startup.

147.title: GoM to finalise report on levying 28% GST on online gaming next week
147.article_body: The Group of Ministers (GoM) will meet on Tuesday to finalise report on GST slab for online gaming, horse racing and casinos. Online games, where no betting or gambling is involved, are currently under 18% GST slab but GoM in May had proposed imposing 28% GST. GST Council had asked ministers to review and finalise the report by July 15.

148.title: Alia wraps 'Heart of Stone' shoot, Gal Gadot calls her 'amazing talent'
148.article_body: Alia Bhatt took to Instagram to share that she has wrapped up the shoot for her debut Hollywood film, 'Heart of Stone' where she'll share screen space with Gal Gadot and Jamie Dornan. Gadot shared a picture with Alia on her Instagram Stories, writing, "Give some love to my girl...who wrapped on #HeartOfStone. Such an amazing talent and...a great person."

149.title: My competition is not with people of my age, it's with youngsters: Anupam
149.article_body: Anupam Kher opened up about his fitness and what keeps him motivated and said, "Unless you make yourself uncomfortable...how will you inspire...others?" He added his competition isn't with the people of his age, it's with the youngsters. The 67-year-old actor further said he feels he has just reached the interval of his career, adding, "I still have...20-25 years of work...[left]."

150.title: India reports 18,840 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 1,25,028
150.article_body: India has reported 18,840 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 18,815 COVID-19 cases. Active cases in India stand at 1,25,028, while the death toll has risen to 5,25,386, according to the latest data.

151.title: What reasons did Elon Musk give for ending the $44 billion Twitter deal?
151.article_body: Apart from citing the lack of information regarding fake accounts, Tesla CEO Elon Musk's lawyers stated the insufficient data on financial condition, recent layoffs and hiring freeze by Twitter as reasons for ending the deal. The filing said Twitter fired two high-level employees and one-third of its talent acquisition team, breaching its obligation to preserve company's material components.

152.title: Very heavy rainfall warning issued for several states, list released
152.article_body: The IMD has stated that fairly widespread/widespread rainfall with isolated heavy rainfall is very likely over Chhattisgarh, Madhya Pradesh, Odisha, Maharashtra, Gujarat, Kerala, Andhra Pradesh, Telangana and Karnataka during next 5 days. It added that extremely heavy rainfall is likely over Goa during next five days. Uttarakhand and Himachal Pradesh may witness heavy rainfall until July 12.

153.title: Japan releases statement after Shinzo Abe's death
153.article_body: Japan Prime Minister Fumio Kishida has released a statement after the death of former PM Shinzo Abe. "The despicable act that took the life of Mr Abe Shinzo...is absolutely intolerable, and I condemn it in the strongest possible terms," he said. Kishida further said that Abe "possessed outstanding leadership and execution ability". "I cannot hold back my grief," he added.

154.title: 25 buildings to be self-demolished in Mumbai's Sion-Koliwada
154.article_body: After an eight-year-long battle between the residents and BMC, 25 buildings at Guru Tegh Bahadur (GTB) Nagar in Sion-Koliwada will be self-demolished starting Monday. BMC had declared the buildings that once housed 1,200 families dangerous for habitation by placing them under the C-1 category in 2014. At the beginning of 2022, the BMC disconnected their electricity and water supply.

155.title: Death toll rises to 15 in Amarnath cloudburst; 15,000 people moved to safety
155.article_body: The death toll due to the cloudburst near Amarnath cave in Jammu and Kashmir has risen to 15, Indian Army officials said. About 15,000 people have been safely shifted so far, Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) added. "Most of the pilgrims who were stranded near holy cave area due to flash flood last evening [have been] shifted to Panjtarni," ITBP stated.

156.title: If Ashwin can be dropped from Tests, why can't Kohli be dropped from T20Is: Kapil Dev
156.article_body: India's 1983 World Cup-winning captain Kapil Dev suggested that Virat Kohli should be dropped from India's T20I side as he is not batting at the level he should be performing. He further asked that if Ravichandran Ashwin can be dropped from Tests, why Kohli can't be dropped from T20Is. The second England-India T20I to take place today.

157.title: 'Alaska is ours' billboards seen in Russia after it threatened to 'take it back' from US
157.article_body: After Speaker of Russia's Lower House of Parliament, Vyacheslav Volodin, threatened to "take back" Alaska from US if the country froze or seized Russian assets over Ukraine invasion, billboards reading "Alaska is ours" surfaced in Russia's Krasnoyarsk. A company named Alaska claimed responsibility for the billboards and said that its director was "very patriotic".

158.title: Pune airport's multilevel parking facility to be ready by Oct: Official
158.article_body: The construction work of Pune airport's multilevel parking facility is expected to be finished by October this year. "Around 90% of work is completed. The delivery of few items like escalators and elevators, bought from foreign countries, is delayed," said Santosh Dhoke, Director, Pune airport. Notably, the project's cost is ₹120 crore and will be able to accommodate 1,000 cars.

159.title: Twitter got busted for spam accounts: Trump's son on Musk ending deal
159.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump's son Donald Trump Jr took to Twitter to comment on Elon Musk ending his $44-billion Twitter deal and said, "So basically Twitter has a huge amount of spam accounts...and has gotten busted for it!!!" "As I said weeks ago spam accounts are probably 50% not 5% of Twitter users," he added.

160.title: The faster the bowler, the more easily Suryakumar plays him: Ajay Jadeja
160.article_body: Talking about Team India batter Suryakumar Yadav, ex-India cricketer Ajay Jadeja said, "The faster the bowler comes, the more easily he plays him...He goes inside the line against...[pacers] and uses their pace." Ex-India batter Sanjay Manjrekar stated Suryakumar can play 10-15 different types of sweep shots and cover drives. "Some of the shots he plays [leave] you astonished," added Manjrekar.

161.title: US man gets arrested for selling thousands of fake Cisco equipment
161.article_body: A 38-year-old US man was arrested by authorities for allegedly procuring fake Cisco equipment from suppliers in China and Hong Kong and selling them on platforms like Amazon and eBay. Onur Aksoy sold products that if authentic would be worth more than $1 billion. He imported tens of thousands of fake devices through at least 19 entities from 2013-2022.

162.title: Work on Mumbai-Ahmedabad bullet train corridor to begin soon: Dy CM Fadnavis
162.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis on Friday said that work on the Mumbai-Ahmedabad bullet train corridor will start soon. "For certain reasons, Maharashtra remained behind while Gujarat worked swiftly for the bullet train," he said. "We've decided to catch up because it is not just a bullet train but the beginning of a new phase of transportation," he added.

163.title: Pune city has recorded a 44.38% rain deficit till now: IMD
163.article_body: Pune city has recorded a rain deficit of 44.38% between June 1 and July 8, an India Meteorological Department official said. The city still has a deficit of 82.8 mm as the normal rainfall was reported at 104.1 mm, the official added. On Friday, Shivajinagar reported 3.1 mm, Pashan reported 4 mm and Chinchwad reported 1.5 mm rainfall.

164.title: G-20 ministers fail to reach common ground on Russia-Ukraine war
164.article_body: The G-20 Foreign Ministers Summit in Bali, Indonesia, on Friday failed to develop consensus on the Russia-Ukraine war and its ramifications. Russian Minister Sergey Lavrov walked out of the statements delivered by Germany and Ukraine. The divisive atmosphere was evident as the traditional group photo of the ministers was not taken, neither was a joint, final communique issued.

165.title: After complaint, B'luru police says it will clear parked tractor
165.article_body: Following a complaint about a parked tractor by a Twitter user, Bengaluru's HSR Layout Traffic Police Station on Friday said that the unauthorised parking of the vehicle will be cleared. "Can this tractor be removed, it's parked here from Stone Age," the Twitter user had said. The traffic police also thanked the Twitter user for the information.

166.title: Man who killed wife found dead in jail in Pune; suicide suspected
166.article_body: A man who was lodged at Pune's Yerwada Central Prison after he allegedly murdered his wife was found hanging from a tree on the prison's premises. Prima facie, it is suspected that the accused died by suicide. The jail's staff found that the undertrial was missing during a routine check on Thursday afternoon and then later found the body.

167.title: Tribal woman who was set on fire by 3 men over land dispute in MP dies
167.article_body: A 38-year-old tribal woman, who was allegedly set on fire by three men over a land dispute in Madhya Pradesh's Guna on July 2, died on Friday, police said. While two of the accused have been arrested, a search is ongoing for the third accused, police added. The woman's husband claimed that the accused had forcibly taken his land.

168.title: Tesla crash that killed 66-yr-old driver, passenger under probe in US
168.article_body: The US NHTSA will open a special investigation into a Tesla crash that killed a 66-year-old Tesla driver and a 67-year-old passenger in Florida. Both the people were pronounced dead at the accident scene after a Tesla rear-ended a parked tractor-trailer in the Gainesville area at a rest area. It is reportedly unclear if Tesla's Autopilot was in use.

169.title: Will pursue legal action to enforce merger: Twitter after Musk ends $44 billion deal
169.article_body: Twitter's Chairman Bret Taylor has said that the board plans to pursue legal action against Tesla CEO Elon Musk after he pulled out of the $44 billion deal. Taylor tweeted, "The Twitter Board is committed to closing the transaction on the price and terms agreed upon with Musk and plans to pursue legal action to enforce the merger agreement."

170.title: Jadeja deletes posts related to CSK from his Instagram account, sparks rumours of rift
170.article_body: All-rounder Ravindra Jadeja deleted posts related to CSK from his Instagram account, sparking rumours of rift between him and the franchise. "The management needs to talk to Jadeja about what's the problem," a fan reacted. "Something is definitely not right," wrote another. Jadeja was named CSK captain for 2022 season, however, he stepped down in the middle of the tournament.

171.title: 28-yr-old man, denied food after b'day party, stabs 4 women in Delhi
171.article_body: A 28-year-old drunk man who was denied food after a birthday party allegedly stabbed three sisters and their mother in Delhi's Dwarka, police said. The incident took place following the birthday party of a five-year-old when around midnight, the accused took out a knife and stabbed the victims. A case of attempt to murder has been registered, police added.

172.title: Biden mistakenly reads part on teleprompter that says 'repeat the line'; video viral
172.article_body: A video showing US President Joe Biden reading a part on teleprompter that said "repeat the line" has gone viral on social media. Biden appeared unaware as to what and what not to read out loud from the teleprompter. Reacting to the video, Elon Musk tweeted, "Whoever controls the teleprompter is the real President!"

173.title: Elon Musk terminates $44 billion deal to buy Twitter over breach of agreement
