173.article_body: The world's richest person and Tesla CEO Elon Musk on Friday said that he was terminating his $44 billion deal to acquire Twitter, alleging multiple breaches of the agreement. In a filing, Musk’s lawyers said Twitter had failed to respond to multiple requests for information on fake or spam accounts on the platform, which was fundamental to the company's performance.

174.title: Further sanctions may cause 'catastrophic' rise in gas price: Putin
174.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Friday said that further sanctions against Russia could lead to "catastrophic" price rise in the global energy market. He said Europe's attempt to replace Russian energy resources would expectedly result in an increase in spot price of gas. He also said, "Sanctions...on Russia cause much more damage to those countries that impose them."

175.title: Woman living in India since 1966 moves Bombay HC for citizenship
175.article_body: A 67-year-old woman who has been living in Mumbai since 1966 has filed a petition before Bombay HC seeking directions to the Centre to grant her Indian citizenship. Ila Popat's advocate informed a division bench that she was born in Uganda to Indian-origin parents with British passports. He added that Ila came to India on her mother's passport in 1966.

176.title: Man gets first prison term for anti-war remarks in Russia
176.article_body: In a first, a Russian court on Friday awarded seven years of imprisonment to a member of a Moscow municipal council for spreading "false information" about the war in Ukraine. The first two convictions under the law led to a fine and a suspended sentence, according to a legal aid group. The law was passed after Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

177.title: 2 killed, 5 injured after landslide in Manipur
177.article_body: Two people were killed and five were wounded after the vehicle they were travelling got swept away into a gorge by a landslide that hit NH 102 in Manipur's Churachandpur district on Friday, police said. The landslide hit just after the passengers of the vehicle cleared the debris and tree branches that were blocking the vehicle's path, police added.

178.title: Indian official inaugurates Nepal school building built with Indian aid
178.article_body: First Secretary of Indian embassy, Karun Bansal, on Friday inaugurated the third building of a secondary school in Nepal's Kapilvastu district. The building was constructed with grant assistance from the Indian government at a cost of ₹2.12 crore, an embassy release said. This is one of the projects being inaugurated under the 'Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav' celebrations, the release added.

179.title: Curtain used to separate male, female students in Kerala for Gender Politics class
179.article_body: A photo shared on social media shows male and female students of a government medical college in Thrissur, Kerala, attending a class with a curtain separating both the genders. Topic of the class was on sensitising the students on 'Gender Politics'. As the incident garnered criticism, the students' union of the college said the class wasn't held on its campus.

180.title: Milind Soman-starrer 'Captain Vyom' to make comeback with reboot
180.article_body: Filmmaker Ketan Mehta has announced that Milind Soman-starrer science-fiction superhero show 'Captain Vyom' will make a comeback with a new-age reboot. "Captain Vyom is an Indian-origin superhero for a global audience. And it's time to reinvent when India is dreaming of its space in the new century," Ketan said. The television show aired on Doordarshan in the late 1990s.

181.title: Akshay Kumar's first look from new film leaked, pic goes viral
181.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar's first look as mining engineer Jaswant Singh Gill from his upcoming film has been leaked. The picture, which is going viral on social media, shows Akshay wearing a turban in a field reported to be in UK's Yorkshire. The film is being referred to as 'Capsule Gill', however, the producers have not announced the title yet.

182.title: Banking, internet services disrupted in Canada as Rogers faces network outage
182.article_body: A major outage of Canadian telecom provider Rogers' mobile and internet networks on Friday disrupted banking services across the country. "Our technical teams are working hard to restore services as quickly as possible," the firm said on Twitter. This is the second major outage to hit one of the biggest telecom providers in Canada in 15 months.

183.title: Extend support to NDA's Prez candidate Murmu: Shiv Sena MP to Uddhav
183.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Rajendra Gavit has urged party chief Uddhav Thackeray to support Droupadi Murmu's candidature in the Presidential election. Gavit, who belongs to a tribal community, is the second Sena MP to suggest that the party back NDA's Presidential candidate. It would be an honour if a tribal person became the President, Gavit said in a letter to Thackeray.

184.title: Have spoken to J&K LG: Shah after cloudburst near Amarnath cave
184.article_body: After a cloudburst was reported near Amarnath cave in Jammu and Kashmir, Union Home Minister Amit Shah tweeted, saying he has spoken to LG Manoj Sinha to take stock of the situation. "Our priority is to save the lives of people," Shah tweeted. NDRF, SDRF, BSF and the local administration are involved in rescue operations, he added.

185.title: Shinzo Abe's assassin said he used handmade gun: Japanese Police
185.article_body: Japanese Police on Friday said the assassin of former Prime Minister Shinzo Abe told officers that he had used a handmade gun. "That's the suspect's assertion, and we have determined that (the gun) is clearly handmade in appearance, although our analysis is currently ongoing," a police officer said. Investigators found several other handmade guns at his one-room flat, police added.

186.title: I really did want Wimbledon semis match: Kyrgios after Nadal's withdrawal
186.article_body: After reaching his maiden Grand Slam final at Wimbledon following Rafael Nadal's withdrawal on the eve of their semi-final match due to an abdominal injury, unseeded Nick Kyrgios said, "As a competitor, I really did want that match." He added that he was hoping for a "third chapter" after going 1-1 in two previous matches against Nadal at Wimbledon.

187.title: Djokovic becomes 2nd male player in Open Era with most wins at Wimbledon
187.article_body: Three-time defending champion Novak Djokovic surpassed Jimmy Connors and is the second male player behind Roger Federer(105) in the Open Era with most wins at Wimbledon following his 85th win on Friday. The top seed defeated ninth seed Cameron Norrie 2-6, 6-3, 6-2, 6-4 in the semi-final. It is Djokovic's 27th straight win at the grass-court Grand Slam.

188.title: Without inclusion, real growth is not possible: PM Modi
188.article_body: Speaking at the first 'Arun Jaitley Memorial Lecture' in Delhi, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said that real growth is not possible without inclusive growth. "Today's India is preparing a roadmap for the coming 25 years with reforms by conviction rather than reforms by compulsion," PM Modi said. "Our policy-making is based on the pulse of the people," he added.

189.title: UK Opposition leaders get clean chit in 'beergate' incident
189.article_body: UK police on Friday said top Opposition leaders, Keir Starmer and Angela Rayner, would not be fined in the "beergate" incident, where the two were found drinking in a closed setting in northeast England last year. At the time, rules forbade indoor social mixing between households. The police concluded the interaction was an "exception" as part of a workday.

190.title: Mexico accuses former president Peña Nieto of managing illicit funds
190.article_body: Mexico’s anti-money laundering agency has accused ex-President Enrique Peña Nieto of managing millions of dollars in illicit funds. This is the first formal legal accusation against Nieto whose term in office from 2012 to 2018 was clouded by reports of corruption. Though a criminal complaint has been filed against Nieto by the government, prosecutors are yet to file formal charges.

191.title: Over 900 firefighters battle forest fire in southeastern France
191.article_body: Over 900 firefighters supported by water-showering planes battled a forest fire in southeastern France on Friday. In total, 18 firemen have sustained injuries in the operation and more than 1,500 acres of forest land has already been burnt. Officials said drought conditions and winds have strained efforts to contain the blaze as nearby villages were evacuated and highways were closed.

192.title: I told SRK he is the person every B'wood outsider looks up to: Taapsee
192.article_body: Actress Taapsee Pannu has stated that she told Shah Rukh Khan that he is the person every outsider trying to make it in Bollywood looks up to. "His victories are personal, his loss is personal, that is stardom for me...Not what we feel [a] star is," the actress added. The two will be seen together in the upcoming film 'Dunki'.

193.title: Investor Burry takes a dig at Musk, says 'More babies in broken families not the way'
193.article_body: American investor Michael Burry took a dig at Tesla CEO Elon Musk after reports claimed he welcomed twins with a top Neuralink executive last year. "Babies born in...US are at 1950 levels, but that doesn't mean that bosses should sleep with subordinates to try to remedy the situation," Burry tweeted. "More babies in broken families not the way," he added.

194.title: 4 killed, several critical after consuming spurious liquor in West Bengal
194.article_body: Four died and several others were critical after consuming spurious liquor in West Bengal's Purba Bardhaman. The administration and Excise Department had asked to keep all liquor shops closed until further orders. ADG Western Zone Sanjoy Singh and West Burdwan Police Superintendent Kamanasish Sen on Friday reportedly searched the area for spurious liquor shops.

195.title: Govt releases helpline numbers after 13 killed in Amarnath cloudburst
195.article_body: The government has released emergency helpline numbers in view of the cloudburst that happened today in the lower reaches of the Amarnath cave in J&K. At least 13 people were dead and three dozen were missing after a cloudburst triggered flash floods. PM Narendra Modi, while condoling the incident, tweeted, "Anguished by the cloudburst...Condolences to the bereaved families."

196.title: Rishi Kapoor used to called me a 'veteran actor': Taapsee Pannu
196.article_body: Actress Taapsee Pannu has stated that late veteran actor Rishi Kapoor used to call her a "veteran actor" after he got to know that she did over 10 films in the south film industry. "Initially when I met him, the first thing he said was, 'What kind of name is this, Taapsee?' in jest," the actress added.

197.title: 20-year-old woman held for plotting father's murder with boyfriend
197.article_body: A 20-year-old woman and her boyfriend have been arrested in Jharkhand's Seraikela-Kharsawan district for their alleged involvement in planning the murder of the former's father, police said. Kanhaiya Singh, a businessman, was shot dead by unknown assailants on June 29. According to the police, Singh's daughter Aparna conspired to kill him as he opposed her relationship with her boyfriend.

198.title: Djokovic beats Norrie in Wimbledon semi-final, reaches his 32nd Grand Slam final
198.article_body: Twenty-time Grand Slam champion Novak Djokovic defeated Cameron Norrie in the Wimbledon 2022 men's singles semi-final to reach his 32nd Grand Slam final. Djokovic won the match with a scoreline of 2-6, 6-3, 6-2, 6-4 in two hours and 35 minutes. Djokovic will face Nick Kyrgios in the final on Sunday.

199.title: Decide on Vivo's request to operate bank accounts: Delhi HC to ED
199.article_body: The Delhi High Court on Friday asked the Enforcement Directorate (ED) to consider Vivo India's representation seeking permission to use its frozen bank accounts by July 13. The Chinese mobile manufacturer approached the court after ED raided 48 locations belonging to Vivo across the country. Representing the ED, advocate Zoheb Hossain opposed Vivo's plea, saying the petition is premature.

200.title: Govt has fulfilled 95% of promises made before 2019 polls: Andhra CM
200.article_body: YSR Congress President and Andhra Pradesh CM YS Jagan Mohan Reddy on Friday said that his government has fulfilled 95% of the promises made ahead of the 2019 elections. Speaking at the YSRCP's plenary in Amaravati, Jagan Reddy claimed that his government has shown how an administration can be run in a transparent and a corruption-free manner.

201.title: Mexico to stay neutral on war in Ukraine: Obrador ahead of visit to US
201.article_body: Mexican President Andrés Manuel López Obrador on Friday said that his administration would maintain its neutral stance on the conflict between Russia and Ukraine. Obrador also said that he hoped there would be a ceasefire. Obrador's comments come ahead of his visit to the US to meet President Joe Biden next week.

202.title: Samsung working to prevent state-level cyberattacks: Senior exec
202.article_body: Samsung is working with Google and Microsoft to prevent state-level cyberattacks, Samsung Electronics Vice President Dr Seungwon Shin told Financial Express. "We...recognise that there are a large number of state-level cyberattacks...being launched," he said. "As long as [users] use the basic features...on our phones...we will be able to prevent...[phishing] attacks," Dr Shin added.

203.title: NC set to fight a multi-front battle in J&K: Farooq Abdullah
203.article_body: National Conference (NC) President Farooq Abdullah on Friday said that the party is set to fight a multi-front battle in the Union Territory. "On one front, we have to strive for an atmosphere, where...development and job creation are addressed," Abdullah said. "It (NC) has to keep up its peaceful and constitutional fight for...restoration of people's abridged rights," he added.

204.title: Former Angolan President José Eduardo dos Santos dies
204.article_body: José Eduardo dos Santos, who served as the Angolan President for almost four decades till 2017, died at a clinic in Barcelona, Spain on Friday, following a long illness. He was 79. During his tenure Angola became one of the world's largest oil producers, even though the country remained poor and was riddled with corruption.

205.title: India to tour Zimbabwe for three ODIs after six years: Reports
205.article_body: India will tour Zimbabwe for a three-match ODI series next month, as per reports. The three matches will be a part of the ICC ODI Super League and will take place on August 18, 20 and 22, Cricbuzz reported. It will be India's first tour to Zimbabwe in six years. The matches will reportedly take place in Harare.

206.title: 31 students of govt school in Tamil Nadu test positive for COVID-19
206.article_body: At least 31 students of a government school in Andipatti of the Theni district in Tamil Nadu have tested positive for COVID-19, ANI reported on Friday. Apart from the students, 10 parents have also tested positive for the virus. The district education department has temporarily closed the school, while initiatives to sanitise the school have been started.

207.title: Four persons die of electrocution in Maharashtra's Aurangabad
207.article_body: Police said that four persons died after being electrocuted in a village in Maharashtra's Aurangabad district on Friday. All four victims suffered severe electric shocks and died on the spot. The incident took place around 3 pm in the village where work on providing new electricity connection was going on, the police added.

208.title: Hardik should bat in top 5 in any white-ball format: Vaughan
208.article_body: Michael Vaughan lauded Hardik Pandya following his 51(33) in first T20I against England, saying the India all-rounder should bat in the top five in any white-ball format. "If he bats in...top five then it gives so much depth as India can then play an extra batter...pacer or spinner depending on conditions," he added. Hardik batted at number five in Southampton.

209.title: 50 bovines die of suffocation after being locked in J'khand building
209.article_body: Nearly 50 bovines died of suffocation after being locked in a room of an abandoned school building in Jharkhand's Pakur district, the police said. "There were two windows in the room, but both were closed. There was no ventilation," Block Animal Husbandry Officer Farhat Jabbar said. Notably, villagers have been keeping their bovines in the building for years, officials said.

210.title: Chinese forces hold military drills as US Senator visits Taiwan
210.article_body: Chinese forces on Friday held military drills around the Taiwan Strait, PLA's Eastern Theater Command said. The drills come at the same time as US Senator Rick Scott's three-day Taiwan visit during which he is expected to meet President Tsai Ing-wen. A top Chinese general on Thursday had asked the US to cease military "collusion" with Taiwan.

211.title: JEE Main results to be out by July 10: Official
211.article_body: Joint Entrance Examination (JEE) Main 2022 session 1 results will be announced by July 10 and will be available on jeemain.nta.nic.in, an official said. In this year's B.E/B.Tech. (paper I) answer key, four questions have been dropped. JEE Main 2022 was held online this year from June 23 to 29 across over 500 centres in India and abroad.

212.title: Former TN minister R Kamaraj booked in disproportionate assets case
212.article_body: Tamil Nadu legislator and former Food and Civil Supplies Minister R Kamaraj was booked in a disproportionate assets case on Friday, for allegedly amassing ₹58 crore beyond known sources of income. Anti-corruption officials raided 49 locations associated to Kamaraj, including his residences in Thiruvarur and Chennai. Kamaraj's two sons and three associates have also been booked in the case.

213.title: Thousands of people visit Kerala's Lulu malls amid 'midnight sale', pics go viral
213.article_body: In a bid to renew 'nightlife shopping', Lulu International Shopping Mall in Kerala had announced midnight sales. Videos and photos of people visiting their outlets in Kochi and Thiruvananthapuram in huge numbers have surfaced online. A video also showed a confrontation between a crowd of shoppers and the mall's security staff.

214.title: J&K LG cancels SI recruitment drive, recommends CBI probe
214.article_body: J&K LG Manoj Sinha on Friday cancelled the recruitment drive for police sub-inspectors in the state and recommended a CBI investigation into the allegations of irregularities in the selection process. "Govt will soon decide future course of action for fresh recruitment," he said in a tweet. Sinha had ordered a probe into the allegations on June 9.

215.title: Video of Ganguly dancing near London Eye to celebrate 50th birthday goes viral
215.article_body: A video has gone viral on social media showing Sourav Ganguly dancing near the London Eye to celebrate his 50th birthday. In the video, Ganguly can be seen dancing with his friends and family, while his daughter Sana can be seen sitting. "Sana is so embarrassed," someone can be heard saying in the video.

216.title: Don't know how India lost it: Sourav Ganguly on Edgbaston Test
216.article_body: Reacting to India's seven-wicket defeat against England in the rescheduled fifth Test in Edgbaston, BCCI President Sourav Ganguly said, "I don't know how India lost that game." India had set a target of 378 runs, which England chased in 76.4 overs. Joe Root and Jonny Bairstow smashed hundreds in the fourth innings to help England win.

217.title: AAP leader booked for assault in Chandigarh
217.article_body: An Aam Aadmi Party ward councillor in Chandigarh has been booked for allegedly assaulting a private contractor and his driver. According to the police complaint, Councillor Ram Chander Yadav attacked contractor Pardeep Bansal after the latter demanded payment for furniture work done at Ward 15 Community Centre. Yadav denied the charge, saying the police was working for the BJP.

218.title: Stunned, outraged & deeply saddened: Biden on Abe's assassination
218.article_body: Reacting to the assassination of former Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe, US President Joe Biden on Friday said, "I am stunned, outraged, and deeply saddened by the news." "This is a tragedy for Japan and for all who knew him," he added. "His vision of a free and open Indo-Pacific will endure," he further said.

219.title: Ranveer Singh's '83' to be felicitated at Indian Film Festival of Melbourne
219.article_body: Ranveer Singh-starrer '83' will be felicitated at the 2022 Indian Film Festival of Melbourne. Former Indian skipper Kapil Dev, who is portrayed by Ranveer in the film, will be the guest of honour at the festival. The festival was held virtually for the last two years but will make a physical comeback this year with both in-person and online programs.

220.title: After 4-year gap, Dalai Lama to visit Leh on July 15
220.article_body: The Dalai Lama will make his first trip to Leh in about four years on July 15, amidst deteriorating ties between India and China over the eastern Ladakh military standoff. Beijing has repeatedly objected to the Tibetan leader’s visit to the region. The Dalai Lama, 87, will impart teachings and is expected to stay for about a month in Leh.

221.title: Man arrested for selling fake high security number plates in Chandigarh
221.article_body: Police have arrested a man for allegedly selling illegal high security number plates in Chandigarh's Sector 38, officials said. The accused, Tushar Aggarwal, a resident of Sector 41, was sent to two days of police custody on Thursday. Officials said fake high security number plates of Punjab, Haryana, Himachal and Chandigarh were seized from the accused.

222.title: Flood warning in Karnataka's Belagavi, Bagalkote districts amid heavy rains
222.article_body: Flood warnings have been sounded in Bagalkote and Belagavi districts of Karnataka due to heavy rainfall in neighbouring Maharashtra. "Owing to heavy rains in Maharashtra, water discharge by the neighbouring state into the Krishna river and its tributaries has increased," Karnataka Water Resources Minister Govind Karjol said. The inflow into Almatti Dam has crossed 75,200 cusecs, he added.

223.title: Indian-origin Rishi Sunak announces candidacy for UK Prime Minister
223.article_body: The UK's former Finance Minister Rishi Sunak on Friday announced that he's standing to be the next leader of the Conservative Party and UK's Prime Minister. "Someone has to grip this moment and make the right decisions," Sunak said. The development comes a day after Boris Johnson resigned after over 50 Members of Parliament resigned in protest at his leadership.

224.title: PM Modi pens tribute for Shinzo Abe, says 'We mourn his passing as one of our own'
224.article_body: PM Narendra Modi penned a heartfelt tribute for Japan's former PM Shinzo Abe following his assassination on Friday. "I first met him in 2007...Right from that first meeting, our friendship went beyond...the shackles of official protocol," he wrote. He added, "We in India mourn his passing as one of our own, just as he embraced us with an open heart."

225.title: Anguished: PM Modi after cloudburst near Amarnath cave in J&K kills 10
225.article_body: PM Narendra Modi expressed anguish after a cloudburst was reported from the lower reaches of Amarnath cave in Jammu and Kashmir on Friday. PM Modi also spoke to J&K Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha and took stock of the situation. "All possible assistance is being provided to the affected," he said on Twitter. Ten deaths have been reported in the incident.

226.title: India has lost a great friend: Kangana, Anupam condole Shinzo Abe's demise
226.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut took to Instagram Stories to condole former Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe's demise. She wrote, "Sad day. India lost a great friend. Om Shanti." Veteran actor Anupam Kher tweeted, "Deeply saddened & shocked by the assassination of former PM of Japan #ShinzoAbe! He was one of the most compassionate world leaders! And a great friend of India!"

227.title: He is the best spinner in the world right now: Swann on Chahal
227.article_body: Speaking about Yuzvendra Chahal, ex-England spinner Graeme Swann stated the 31-year-old Indian is the best spinner in the world right now. "In T20 cricket, I think it's absolutely unarguable, he  absolutely is," he added. Chahal posted bowling figures of 4-0-32-2 against England in the first T20I in Southampton. The visitors defeated England by 50 runs on Thursday.

228.title: Russia has barely started its action: President Putin to Ukraine
228.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Thursday warned the Ukrainian government that Russia has barely started its action in Ukraine. Putin said, "We have heard many times that the West wants to fight us to the last Ukrainian." "This is a tragedy for the Ukrainian people, but it seems that everything is heading towards this," he added.

229.title: I work to keep myself busy, I don't need money: Neetu Kapoor
229.article_body: Actress Neetu Kapoor stated in an interview that she is working to keep herself busy and happy, adding that she doesn't need money. "At this age, I don't need to be famous...The time when I wanted things has passed," she added. The actress further said that she enjoys talking to media persons and journalists and even remembers their names now.

230.title: Common man should get priority over VIPs: Maha CM to police
230.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Friday instructed the police that his convoy does not require a special protocol and asked them not to hold up traffic for his convoy across the state. "This is a government of the common man so he should get priority over VIPs," Shinde said. It causes traffic snarls and burdens the police force, he added.

231.title: Difficult to believe that Japan's ex-PM Abe is no more: Prez Kovind
231.article_body: Expressing grief over the assassination of ex-Japanese PM Shinzo Abe, President Ram Nath Kovind tweeted, "I find it difficult to believe that...Abe is no more." "He was a great statesman, & his infectious affability endeared him the world over," he added. "That he fell prey to an assassin's bullet is a tragedy for the whole humanity," he further said.

232.title: Dare TMC to arrest me: BJP's Dilip Ghosh on remarks on WB CM
232.article_body: West Bengal BJP leader Dilip Ghosh dared the TMC government to arrest him for his comments on Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee. "TMC is falling on the feet of the governor so that I can be arrested. They are shameless!" Ghosh tweeted. Ghosh's comment comes after a TMC delegation met Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar and sought action against him.

233.title: Maharashtra is the engine of India's economy: Deputy CM Fadnavis
233.article_body: BJP leader and Maharashtra's Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis on Friday said that "Maharashtra is the engine of India's economy". He said, "We made...pledge in 2015 to grow to a trillion-dollar economy by 2030. I renew that pledge today under Maharashtra's CM Eknath Shinde's leadership." "If we keep progressing as a nation, we can become a seven trillion economy," he added.

234.title: 19-year-old man feared drowned in river in Thane's Bhiwandi
234.article_body: A 19-year-old man, Mohammad Asif, was feared drowned in a river in Thane's Bhiwandi on Friday, an official from the fire brigade said. "The incident took place at Bhiwandi's Kamwari river...around 1 pm when the victim...had ventured into the water for a swim along with four others," the official said. Asif was swept away by strong currents, he added.

235.title: Redmi K50i 5G outscores iPhone 13 in AnTuTu benchmark score: Redmi India
235.article_body: Redmi India announced today that its upcoming smartphone, Redmi K50i 5G has outscored iPhone 13 in AnTuTu scores. The brand tweeted its benchmark score of 8,22,274 points, as compared to 7,82,653 points scored by iPhone 13's A15 chipset (4-core). The smartphone is reportedly powered by the flagship MediaTek Dimensity 8100 and will be launched in India on July 20.

236.title: Man dies by suicide inside washroom of PVR Cinemas in Delhi: Reports
236.article_body: A man in his 40s allegedly died by suicide inside the washroom of PVR Cinemas in Delhi's Vikaspuri on Friday, as per reports. An Aadhaar card was found in the pocket of the deceased, on the basis of which he was identified. So far, the reason behind the suicide has not been ascertained, reports further stated.

237.title: Cloudburst near Amarnath cave in J&K kills 5, video shows tents coming under flash floods
237.article_body: A cloudburst has been reported from the lower reaches of Amarnath cave in Jammu & Kashmir. Some tents have come under flash floods and five deaths have been reported. Rescue operation is in progress and the injured are being airlifted for treatment. The situation is under control, said IGP Kashmir, Vijay Kumar.

238.title: India's Prannoy beats world no. 14 Tsuneyama to enter Malaysia Masters semis
238.article_body: India's HS Prannoy entered the semi-final of Malaysia Masters 2022 after beating world number 14 Kanta Tsuneyama 25-23, 22-20 on Friday. The 29-year-old won the quarter-final match in one hour. Unseeded Prannoy, who is the only Indian left in the tournament, will face eighth seeded Ng Ka Long Angus. Hong Kong's Long Angus defeated Chou Tien Chen 13-21, 21-12, 21-13.

239.title: Ashneer Grover and his wife incorporate new company called 'Third Unicorn'
239.article_body: BharatPe's ex-MD Ashneer Grover and his wife Madhuri Jain have incorporated a new company named 'Third Unicorn Private Limited'. The company was incorporated on July 6 and lists Ashneer and Madhuri as Directors. Madhuri was previously the Head of Controls at BharatPe. On his 40th birthday last month, Ashneer had tweeted, "Time to disrupt another sector. It's time for...Third Unicorn."

240.title: Krawczyk and Skupski win 2nd straight mixed doubles title at Wimbledon
240.article_body: Number two seeds Desirae Krawczyk and Neal Skupski won their second straight mixed doubles Wimbledon title by defeating Australia's Sam Stosur and Matt Ebden 6-4, 6-3 in the final on Thursday. Notably, the British-American duo became the first pair to defend a mixed doubles title since Czech brother-sister duo Cyril Suk and Helena Sukova in 1997.

241.title: Who are the 5 Indian-Americans on Forbes list of richest self-made women in US?
241.article_body: Jayshree Ullal, CEO of Arista Networks, is the richest Indian-American on Forbes list of America's richest self-made women with $1.9 billion net worth. The list features Syntel Co-founder Neerja Sethi and Confluent Co-founder Neha Narkhede with $1 billion and $490 million fortune, respectively. PepsiCo's ex-CEO Indra Nooyi, who's worth $320 million, is the 4th richest Indian-American on the list.

242.title: Cyber crimes against India initiated by 2 hacker groups after Nupur Sharma incident
242.article_body: In the aftermath of Nupur Sharma incident, two hacker groups namely 'DragonForce Malaysia' and 'Hacktivist Indonesia' initiated a cyber war against India, said Amit Vasava, DCP, Cyber Crime, Ahmedabad. "Over two thousand websites were hacked...Ahmedabad Cyber Crime has written to Malaysian and Indonesian governments along with writing to Interpol for lookout notice for both groups," Vasava added.

243.title: 7 MP college students fined for chanting Hanuman Chalisa; minister orders probe
243.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Home Minister Narottam Mishra has said that no fine will be imposed on the seven students of Vellore Institute of Technology (VIT) in Bhopal for chanting Hanuman Chalisa. "If Hanuman Chalisa is not chanted in Hindustan, then where?" he added. Mishra further said that he has asked the District Collector to probe the matter.

244.title: Actor Vikram did not have cardiac arrest, doctors confirm
244.article_body: After Tamil actor Vikram was hospitalised, his doctors confirmed in a statement that he did not suffer cardiac arrest and is clinically stable. It further stated that the actor will be discharged from the hospital soon. Vikram was admitted to Chennai's Kauvery Hospital on Friday after complaining of discomfort in his chest. His publicist said that he had high fever.

245.title: Ram Charan & I don't want children for population control: Upasana
245.article_body: Actor Ram Charan's wife Upasana Kamineni Konidela said that the couple does not want to have children for population control. She further said the 'RRR' in her life stands for relationship, reproduction and role in life. Earlier, Ram Charan spoke about it, saying he has the responsibility of making fans happy and having children will deviate him from his mission.

246.title: Pained to learn about assassination of Japan's ex-PM Shinzo Abe: Shah
246.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Friday expressed grief over the assassination of former PM of Japan, Shinzo Abe. Taking to Twitter, Shah said, "Pained to learn about the assassination of...India's valued friend, Shinzo Abe. His efforts in strengthening...India-Japan relationship will always be held fondly in our memories." "My deepest condolences to his family...and...people of Japan," he added.

248.title: ED summons Delhi minister Satyendar Jain's wife in money laundering case
248.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate on Friday issued summons to Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain's wife Poonam Jain to appear before it at its headquarters for questioning on July 14 in connection with a money laundering case. This comes months after the ED arrested Satyendar Jain on May 30 in connection with alleged hawala transactions related to a Kolkata-based company.

249.title: That's snake sh*t: Doja on Noah sharing private chat about Joseph
249.article_body: Singer Doja Cat criticised actor Noah Schnapp in an Instagram Live session for sharing their private chat about actor Joseph Quinn in a TikTok post. She said, "[It's] so unbelievably like socially unaware and wack...that's like borderline snake sh*t, that's like weasel sh*t." Doja further said that when people are young, they do "dumb sh*t" and "f*ck up relationships".

250.title: TCS Q1 profit rises 5.21% y-o-y to ₹9,478 cr, revenue at ₹52,758 cr
250.article_body: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) has reported a 5.21% rise in its net profit at ₹9,478 crore for the April-June quarter of FY23, compared to ₹9,008 crore from the same quarter a year ago. The company's revenue rose by 16.2% year-on-year to ₹52,758 crore. TCS has also declared an interim dividend of ₹8 per share.

251.title: Steve Bannon's lawyer asks to withdraw from case
251.article_body: Steve Bannon, talk show host and former White House advisor to former President Donald Trump, looks on as he leaves an appearance in U.S. District Court in Washington, U.S., November 15, 2021. REUTERS/Kevin Lamarque. Steve Bannon's lawyer asks to withdraw from case. Steve Bannon's lawyer asks to withdraw from case.

252.title: India goalkeeper Gurpreet Singh Sandhu marries longtime girlfriend Devenish, shares pic
252.article_body: Indian men's football team goalkeeper Gurpreet Singh Sandhu married his longtime girlfriend Devenish Singh. Sharing a picture from the wedding on social media, he wrote, "Signed the most important contract of my life. Our lives, now. The thought of spending the rest of our days together ends up making everyday after this one, the happiest of our lives."

253.title: I don't have any idea what it is, don't really like that silly term: McCullum on 'Bazball'
253.article_body: Talking about the term 'Bazball' used to describe England's attacking style in Test cricket, England head coach Brendon McCullum, who is nicknamed Baz, said, "I don't have any idea what Bazball is." He added, "I don't really like that silly term...because there's actually quite a bit of thought that goes into how the guys manufacture their performances."

254.title: Bengaluru's Idgah Maidan to remain a playground: Cong MLA
254.article_body: Congress MLA BZ Zameer Ahmed Khan on Friday said that the Idgah Maidan in Chamarajpet locality of Bengaluru will remain a playground forever. "Everyone demanded that the playground must be preserved. Where has the playground gone? Who has tried to remove it? Whether MLA, BBMP or Wakf Board have stated that the playground will cease to exist here?" Zameer questioned.

255.title: Beating Novak in Slam not easy: Murray on Norrie's chances in Wimbledon semis
255.article_body: Talking about compatriot Cameron Norrie's chances against three-time defending champion Novak Djokovic in the semi-final at Wimbledon, Great Britain's Andy Murray said it's going to be an "unbelievably difficult challenge" for the ninth seed. "To beat someone like Novak in a Slam is not easy, but Cam [Norrie] is playing well and he'll be confident," he added.

256.title: Saddened to know about demise of former Japan PM Shinzo Abe: Kejriwal
256.article_body: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal expressed condolences and said he is saddened to know about the demise of former Japan PM Shinzo Abe. "The world has lost a great leader. May the departed soul rest in peace," Kejriwal tweeted. Shinzo Abe was shot while delivering a speech in the city of Nara.

257.title: Articles call 'Dhaakad' flop, no one talks about 'Radhe Shyam', '83': Kangana
257.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut recently wrote on Instagram Stories that hundreds of articles are calling 'Dhaakad' a flop. She shared a screenshot of an article calling 'Gangubai Kathiawadi', '83', 'Radhe Shyam' and 'JugJugg Jeeyo' flops, writing, "No one is talking about these big disasters...any specific reason?" Kangana wrote in another story that the negative PR for 'Dhaakad' has not stopped.

258.title: Sindhu loses to Tai Tzu for 2nd time in 2 weeks at Malaysia Masters
258.article_body: Ex-world champion PV Sindhu crashed out of Malaysia Masters 2022 after losing to Tai Tzu Ying 13-21, 21-12, 12-21 in the quarter-final on Friday. This was seventh seeded Sindhu's seventh straight loss to second seeded Tai Tzu and 17th defeat in 22 matches. Notably, Sindhu lost to Tai Tzu in the quarter-final at Malaysia Open last week.

259.title: Thieves cut hole in wall, steal jewellery worth ₹65 lakh from shop in Guj
259.article_body: Police said a jewellery showroom in Gujarat's Vapi was robbed of gold ornaments worth ₹65.94 lakh on Thursday night after thieves entered by cutting a hole in a wall. It was a planned robbery as the thieves allegedly rented a shop sharing a wall with the showroom, police added. All the jewellery items that were on display were reportedly missing.

260.title: No one can take away Sena's 'bow & arrow' symbol: Uddhav Thackeray
260.article_body: Maharashtra's former CM and Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray on Friday said the 'bow and arrow' symbol will always remain with the party. "There's a discussion going on about the party's symbol. As per the law, no one can take away 'bow and arrow' from Shiv Sena," he added. Thackeray further demanded that mid-term elections should be held in Maharashtra.

261.title: 2 unidentified men attempt to break into ATMs in Thane, case filed
261.article_body: Police on Thursday said two unidentified persons allegedly attempted to break into two ATMs in Thane's Bhiwandi. The accused tried to open the machines using a screwdriver to remove cash, police said, adding both the machines were damaged. A case has been registered under IPC sections 380 (theft), 511 (attempt to commit offence) and 427 (mischief causing damage), they added.

262.title: Bengaluru Police raid fake call centre in Whitefield, 6 detained
262.article_body: Bengaluru Police on Friday detained six people and seized items worth ₹2 crore during a raid on a fake call centre in Whitefield. The seized items include 127 desktops, four laptops, 10 internal hard disks, six iPhones, three luxury cars and ₹18 lakh in cash. The company running the call centre was involved in cybercrimes, according to the police.

263.title: Man robbed of ₹8,000 in Hyderabad, 2 accused held within 24 hours
263.article_body: The Hyderabad Police arrested two men for allegedly robbing a man of ₹8,000 within 24 hours of the crime. Police said the accused Bommenna Srikar and Vagmera Vijay Kumar approached Mohd Shahzad, pretending to seek directions, while he was on his way home after withdrawing money from an ATM. Police also recovered a two-wheeler and two mobile phones from them.

264.title: GHMC to set up 2 more construction & debris plants in Hyderabad
264.article_body: The Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) announced setting up of two construction and debris waste management plants at Charminar and Secunderabad zones. The civic body has come up with the initiative to prevent construction debris from being discharged in lakes and on footpaths. The GHMC has invited tenders to set up plants within a 10 km distance in the city.

265.title: Waiting for divorce from Akhilesh Yadav-led SP: SBSP chief
265.article_body: Suheldev Bharatiya Samaj Party chief Om Prakash Rajbhar on Friday said he will not initiate any steps to break SBSP's alliance with the Samajwadi Party and that he is waiting for "talaq" (divorce) from Akhilesh Yadav-led SP. Rajbhar added that he is "still with the SP, but will not remain together forcefully if Akhilesh Yadav doesn't want it".

266.title: Andhra CM Reddy's mother quits YSR Cong Party to support daughter in T'gana
266.article_body: YS Vijayamma, mother of Andhra Pradesh CM YS Jagan Mohan Reddy, on Friday resigned as the honorary president of the ruling YSR Congress Party. Vijayamma said she will now support her daughter YS Sharmila, who is heading the YSR Telangana Party in the neighbouring state. "My daughter is fighting alone. If I don’t support her, it'll be injustice," Vijayamma added.

267.title: IAS officer, arrested for sexually harassing IIT student after party in J'khand, suspended
267.article_body: The Jharkhand government on Friday suspended IAS officer Sayyed Riyaj Ahemad, who was arrested for allegedly sexually harassing an IIT student. Ahemad was arrested on Tuesday and sent to judicial custody for two weeks after the engineering student filed a police complaint. He allegedly harassed the girl after attending dinner party hosted at the Deputy Development Commissioner's residence.

268.title: 4 minors blackmail and rape 15-yr-old female classmate in TN; arrested
268.article_body: Four minors were arrested in Tamil Nadu for allegedly raping their 15-year-old female classmate after blackmailing her over attending a function without her parents' knowledge. The accused had allegedly taken photos of the girl with a boy, whose birthday party she was attending. They allegedly took her to one of their homes, raped her and filmed the act, police said.

269.title: Apple's Steve Jobs awarded US' highest civilian honour posthumously
269.article_body: US President Joe Biden presented the Presidential Medal of Freedom, US' highest civilian honour, to Apple's late Co-founder Steve Jobs on Thursday. His wife, Laurene Powell Jobs, accepted the award on his behalf. "His (Jobs') vision, imagination and creativity led to inventions that have, and continue to, change the way the world communicates," the White House earlier said.

270.title: Teakwood smuggling racket busted in MP's Indore
270.article_body: Forest officers have busted a teakwood smuggling racket in Indore. The accused would smuggle the teakwood from the forests and send it to the Narmada river by boat. For the past six months, the forest officials have taken more than half a dozen actions to curb teakwood smuggling. Choral range has been a hotspot for timber smugglers.

271.title: He was a friend of India: Sitharaman on demise of Japan's ex-PM Abe
271.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has expressed grief over the demise of former PM of Japan Shinzo Abe. In a tweet on Friday, Sitharaman said, "Express my profound grief on the tragic demise of...Shinzo Abe. He was a friend of India and we held him in great regard." Abe died after being shot while delivering a speech in Japan's Nara city.

272.title: Akshay was upset, felt he got a raw deal: Shabbir Boxwala on 'Mohra'
272.article_body: Producer Shabbir Boxwala, while talking about his film 'Mohra', said Akshay Kumar was upset with the film's title. "He felt that the title was biased towards Suniel and...he got a raw deal. However, we reasoned that he had an equally important role," Shabbir added. "Through...song, 'Tu Cheez Badi Hai Mast', the...money he made is mind-boggling," Shabbir further said.

273.title: Kohli should open the batting if he plays in 2nd T20I vs England: Swann
273.article_body: Graeme Swann has said if Virat Kohli returns to India's playing XI in second T20I against England then he should open innings with captain Rohit Sharma. "When you've got a player as good as Virat, you don't want him batting at number three in...middle overs because he isn't going to score as quickly as...Suryakumar Yadav or Deepak Hooda," he added.

274.title: Elon Musk's SpaceX running anti-5G narrative, says US non-profit
274.article_body: US non-profit '5G for 12 GHz Coalition' has accused Elon Musk's SpaceX of initiating a "public misinformation campaign" against 5G. It said that SpaceX lied to customers about how expanding certain airwaves for 5G could disrupt its Starlink satellite internet service. "This tactic, which is commonly used by Musk...promulgates an anti-5G narrative that is harmful to American consumers," it added.

275.title: ED fines Amnesty India ₹51 cr, ex-CEO Aakar Patel ₹10 cr for FEMA violations
275.article_body: Amnesty India International Pvt Ltd and its former CEO Aakar Patel have been fined ₹51.72 crore and ₹10 crore, respectively, the Directorate of Enforcement (ED) said on Friday. The ED added that its Adjudicating Authority has adjudicated a show cause notice to Amnesty India and Patel for contravention of the provisions of FEMA (Foreign Exchange Management Act, 1999).

276.title: Steve Smith smashes an international hundred for the first time in 18 months
276.article_body: Australia batter Steve Smith on Friday smashed his first hundred in international cricket in 18 months. The 33-year-old reached the three-figure mark off 193 deliveries in the first innings of the second Test against Sri Lanka. Steve Smith has now hit 28 hundreds in Test cricket. Smith has hit five Test hundreds in Asia.

277.title: Great player, superb leader: Harbhajan to Ganguly on his 50th birthday
277.article_body: Harbhajan Singh took to Twitter to wish Sourav Ganguly on his 50th birthday on Friday. "A great player, a superb leader, the BCCI President and my captain...Dada have a wonderful year ahead. Love always!" he wrote. Yuvraj Singh tweeted, "Happy Birthday Dada! You've been a great friend, an impactful captain and a senior any youngster would want to learn from."

278.title: Campus Fund raises ₹75 crore to invest in student-led startups
278.article_body: Campus Fund, which invests in student-led startups, announced that it has raised ₹75 crore for its second fund. IIFL Wealth, Omidyar Network India and ex-Chairman of HDFC Securities Bharat Shah were among those who participated in the round. Campus Fund was launched in July 2020. Its first fund had a corpus of ₹7 crore which was invested across 10 startups.

279.title: 12-yr-old girl kidnapped, raped on way home from school in Jharkhand
279.article_body: A 12-year-old girl was allegedly raped by two men in Jharkhand's Dumka. She was going home from school to collect a notebook that she had forgotten to carry. The accused, who were in a car, asked her about a river and when she stopped to reply, they abducted her, raped her and dumped her in Godda, the girl told police.

280.title: Bihar man enters classroom with sword after child denied money for uniform
280.article_body: A man in Bihar's Araria district allegedly barged into a school with a sword and threatened teachers after he didn't get money for his child's school uniform, police said. The man also told the teachers that he would return if he did not get the money within 24 hours. An FIR has been registered against the man following the incident.

281.title: Philippine President in isolation after testing +ve for coronavirus
281.article_body: Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr is in isolation after testing positive for coronavirus in an antigen test, his spokeswoman said on Friday. People who came into contact with the President, including his son, have tested negative for COVID-19, the spokeswoman added. Notably, this comes after Marcos Jr's meeting with Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi on Wednesday.

282.title: Meta virtual reality headsets to no longer require Facebook for login
282.article_body: Facebook parent company Meta said that it'll no longer require people to sign in to their Facebook accounts to use its virtual reality headsets. CEO Mark Zuckerberg announced a new virtual reality login system that will be launched in August 2022. The users will now be required to create a Meta account as well as a social profile, Meta Horizon.

283.title: Expecting Indian boxers to win 4 golds at CWG 2022: Nikhat Zareen
283.article_body: Newly-crowned world boxing champion Nikhat Zareen has said that she is expecting Indian boxers to win four gold medals in this month's Commonwealth Games in Birmingham. "I expect at least eight medals, of which I will take four gold [for Indian] boxers. Let's see what happens...We have World Championship medallists and Olympians," the 26-year-old boxer said.

284.title: I've smashed sixes all my life but now I feel happier hitting a four: Hardik
284.article_body: Hardik Pandya said he has smashed sixes all his life but now "feels happier" after hitting a four, adding it touches his heart. Hardik smashed 51 off 33 balls in the first T20I against England which comprised six fours and a six. Discussing his bowling, Hardik stated, "I was happier seeing 90.5 mph on the speedometer than my overall performance."

285.title: I'm not going to plan it: Ms Marvel's Iman on future Hollywood plans
285.article_body: Pakistani-Canadian actress Iman Vellani, who plays the titular role in 'Ms Marvel', said that she is not going to plan her future in Hollywood. "I didn't even know I could do this. 'Ms Marvel' came out of nowhere...I'm just going to see where life takes me," she added. The actress further said that she is just going with the flow.

286.title: 'Thor: Love...' earns ₹18.6 cr on day 1, more than Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2, Prithviraj
286.article_body: Marvel Studios' 'Thor: Love and Thunder' earned ₹18.60 crore on day one of release in India, film trade analyst Taran Adarsh said. Hindi films such as 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' and 'Samrat Prithviraj' opened at ₹14.1 crore and ₹10.7 crore, respectively. The film, starring Chris Hemsworth and Christian Bale, has been released in English, Hindi, Tamil, Telugu and Malayalam in India.

287.title: Web3 projects have lost more than $2 bn to hacks this yr: Report
287.article_body: Web3 projects have lost more than $2 billion to hacks and exploits in the first half of 2022, more than all of 2021 combined, blockchain auditing and security company CertiK reported. About $308 million was lost across 27 flash loan attacks in the June quarter, while $14 million was lost to flash loans in Q1.

288.title: 25 students rescued after T'gana school bus gets submerged in floodwater
288.article_body: At least 25 school students were rescued by local residents after a bus carrying them got submerged in floodwater in Telangana's Mahabubnagar district on Friday. The bus of a private school was passing under a railway bridge when it got stuck midway. After the rescue of the children, the bus was reportedly pulled out with the help of a tractor.

289.title: When India bowls, Rohit as skipper makes huge impression: Jaffer
289.article_body: Former India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said that limited-overs skipper Rohit Sharma makes a "huge impression" as captain when India is "bowling". "The changes that he [Rohit] makes and the calls that he takes, that makes a huge difference," Jaffer said. "What we've seen of Arshdeep Singh [in the first T20I], I would have given him another game," Jaffer added.

290.title: Volkswagen, partners to invest $20 billion to produce EV batteries
290.article_body: German automobile manufacturer Volkswagen said the company along with its partners will invest over $20 billion to produce electric vehicle (EV) batteries. This will result in the creation of 20,000 jobs and annual sales of above $20 billion by 2030, it added. The announcement was made at the groundbreaking ceremony of the company's first battery plant in Europe.

291.title: PMC to hire pvt agency for mechanical cleaning of Pune's public toilets
291.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation has decided to hire a private agency to clean the city's public toilets using machines. Earlier, the cleaning of toilets was managed by the PMC staff but now it will be handled by an agency for five years, officials said. "The contractor will be responsible for toilets' cleaning, water supply, proper functioning of doors," an official said.

292.title: It doesn't bother me: Nikki on being trolled for crying on Moosewala's death
292.article_body: 'Bigg Boss 14' fame Nikki Tamboli has opened up about being trolled for crying at the airport post Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala's death. "I was very sad when I heard about his death and...broke into tears. It was a natural reaction," Nikki said. "Whether I laugh or cry, I still get trolled, it doesn't bother me now," she added.

293.title: 'Oo Antava' hotter than 'Tip Tip', but Katrina is a better dancer: Ranveer
293.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh, during the rapid-fire round on 'Koffee With Karan season 7', said that Samantha Ruth Prabhu's 'Oo Antava' was hotter than Katrina Kaif's 'Tip Tip'. "I think that's (Oo Antava) the hotter song. So, I prefer that as a song and I prefer the choreography," he said. Ranveer, however, added that Katrina is a better dancer.

294.title: The ball kept sailing over our heads: Russel on Dhoni's 183* vs SL
294.article_body: Talking about MS Dhoni's 183* against Sri Lanka, ex-Sri Lankan cricketer Russel Arnold said, "Sachin Tendulkar was out in the first over and Virender Sehwag was out early too, but then India sprung a surprise." "Dhoni came and quietly took control...The...buzz we had...started disappearing...The ball kept sailing over [our] heads...Each time he hit the ball, it went...further away," he added.

295.title: MCD identifies over 200 houses as unsafe amid monsoon rains in Delhi
295.article_body: NDMC and the MCD surveyed over 26 lakh properties in Delhi to identify hazardous structures that could collapse during the rainy season and ensure their destruction or rehabilitation. Out of over 26 lakh properties surveyed, 266 houses in Delhi were deemed unsafe and owners were given notices, an official said. Reportedly, North Delhi had the maximum number of dangerous buildings.

296.title: Pune civic body to allocate space for organic food stalls in markets
296.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation has decided to allocate space for organic food stalls in the city's marketplaces. The decision has been taken in view of the state government's 'Urban Food System' scheme. "The agriculture companies or groups of farmers can apply...in the PMC...The farmers will have to get their products to market at their own cost," an official said.

297.title: Cut edible oil prices by ₹15 per litre immediately: Govt to edible oil associations
297.article_body: The government has directed leading edible oil associations to cut prices of edible oils by ₹15 per litre with immediate effect. The Centre has advised manufacturers and refiners to reduce the price of oils to distributors. "Whenever a reduction in price to distributors is made by...manufactures or refiners, the benefit should be passed on to the consumers," the government said.

298.title: 'Friends' co-creator apologizes for misgendering Chandler's trans parent
298.article_body: Marta Kauffman, co-creator of American TV show 'Friends', has apologised for misgendering character Chandler Bing's transgender parent, Charles Bing, in the show. Kauffman told Fox News, "Pronouns weren't yet something that I understood. So...we didn't refer to that character as 'she'." "That was a mistake," Kauffman said, adding she regrets referring to Charles as Chandler's father.

299.title: Chilean hockey player proposes to boyfriend after scoring in women's WC, video viral
299.article_body: Chilean hockey player Francisca Tala proposed to her boyfriend after scoring a goal in her team's women's hockey World Cup 2022 match against Netherlands. "I made a bet with the girls that if I made a goal against the Netherlands, I had to marry my boyfriend," she said. Chile have reached the cross-over round in the ongoing World Cup.

300.title: Need over ₹2,000 cr monthly, ED trying to disrupt business: Vivo on frozen accounts
300.article_body: Referring to the Enforcement Directorate freezing its bank accounts, Vivo told the Delhi High Court that it has to make monthly payments of around ₹2,826 crore towards statutory dues, salaries, rent and daily business operations. It added that ED has undertaken a "roving and fishing enquiry” against it and continues to make "various attempts to disrupt" its business.

301.title: Russian bank reusing bank card chips to combat shortage amid Ukraine war
301.article_body: Russian bank SberBank has started reusing chips from un-activated bank cards to combat a shortage resulting from European suppliers halting deliveries amid the Ukraine war. "A shortage of chips for cards has started in Russia. We mostly worked with European chip producers...there is now a big problem with logistics from Europe," SberBank's head of cyber compliance Olga Maklashina said.

302.title: Jacqueline to play actress Priya Rajvansh in director Pradeep Sarkar's next
302.article_body: Jacqueline Fernandez will play the role of actress Priya Rajvansh in her and filmmaker Chetan Anand's biopic. The film will be directed by Pradeep Sarkar and produced by Deepak Mukut. Notably, Priya Rajvansh worked exclusively for Chetan Anand and had starred in films including 'Haqeeqat', 'Heer Raanjha' and 'Hanste Zakhm'. She died on March 27, 2000.

303.title: Alia wishes Neetu Kapoor on her b'day, shares pic from her haldi ceremony
303.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt took to her Instagram Stories on Friday to share a post marking Neetu Kapoor's birthday. Sharing a picture from her haldi ceremony, Alia wrote, "Happiest birthday to the most beautiful soul...My mother-in-law/friend/soon-to-be dadi maaaaa...love you so so much!" Neetu turned 64 on Friday. Alia is expecting her first child with her husband, actor Ranbir Kapoor.

304.title: Who is Indian-origin Suella Braverman, who said she seeks to be UK's next PM?
304.article_body: Indian-origin UK MP Suella Braverman has publicly announced that she intends to seek the position of UK's Prime Minister after Boris Johnson's resignation. The 42-year-old is the UK's second female Attorney General who was appointed as the country's top legal official in February 2020. Braverman has studied Law at Queens' College, Cambridge and was called to the Bar in 2005.

305.title: Russia threatens to 'take back' Alaska from US
305.article_body: The Speaker of Russia's Lower House of Parliament, Vyacheslav Volodin, has threatened to "take back" Alaska from US if the country froze or seized Russian assets as punishment for its invasion of Ukraine. Russia colonised Alaska and established several settlements there until the US purchased it from Russia in 1867 for $7.2 million.

306.title: Actor Vikram admitted to hospital, team refutes reports of heart attack
306.article_body: Tamil actor Vikram was hospitalised on Friday and his publicist confirmed that the actor was taken to hospital after he complained of discomfort due to high fever symptoms. Contrary to some reports that claimed that Vikram suffered a heart attack and was therefore admitted to the hospital, his publicist said it was high fever and he's doing fine.

307.title: India lost a close friend today: Rajnath on ex-Japan PM Abe's assassination
307.article_body: Expressing grief over former Japan Prime Minister Shinzo Abe's assassination on Friday, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh tweeted, "India today has lost a close friend who assiduously worked towards strengthening bilateral relations." "I met with Mr Abe...in 2019. I found him to be an inspiring leader who had the vision to create a safe and better world," Singh added.

308.title: He could play for another 10 years: Finch on 35-yr-old David Warner
308.article_body: Australia limited-overs captain Aaron Finch said 35-year-old Australian batter David Warner could play for another 10 years considering his fitness. "He loves the competition and [continues] to challenge himself," added Finch. "I can't believe people wrote Warner off...It was almost like poking the bear," Finch had said after Australia's triumph in the men's T20 World Cup 2021.

309.title: Lalu Prasad Yadav's health is improving: Daughter Misa Bharti
309.article_body: RJD leader Misa Bharti tweeted that the health of her father Lalu Prasad Yadav is improving. She also shared some photos of the RJD chief from hospital and wrote, "Lalu Ji's condition is much better...because of his morale and your prayers. Please don't pay attention to rumours." Lalu was hospitalised with severe injuries and airlifted to Delhi's AIIMS on Wednesday.

310.title: ED raids 18 places linked to J'khand CM Soren's close aide over tender scam
310.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Friday conducted raids at 18 locations in Jharkhand as part of a money-laundering investigation against MLA Pankaj Mishra, a close aide of Chief Minister Hemant Soren, officials said. The raids were conducted in connection with an alleged scam carried out while availing marketplace tender in Sahibganj's Barharwa in 2020.

311.title: Pics of late actor James Caan with Pacino from The Godfather's premiere go viral
311.article_body: Following the demise of James Caan, the late actor's pictures from the premiere of 'The Godfather' in 1972 have gone viral on social media. In the pictures, Caan can be seen interacting with Al Pacino and Ali MacGraw. The actor passed away aged 82. Mourning his demise, Pacino said, "Hard to believe that he won't be in the world anymore."

312.title: Hazlewood's IPL stint with CSK helped his T20 game: Aaron Finch
312.article_body: Australia limited-overs skipper Aaron Finch has said that pacer Josh Hazlewood's stint with Chennai Super Kings improved his T20 game. "For such a long time Hazlewood's focus was just on Test cricket...I think he got that in the lead-up to the last T20 World Cup while playing all 14 games for CSK," Finch said.

313.title: On-duty ITBP officer shoots himself dead in J&K's Poonch
313.article_body: An on-duty ITBP officer posted in J&K shot himself dead with his service weapon on Friday, officials said. The deceased personnel has been identified as Assistant Sub-Inspector Prem Chand, officials added. The incident took place at the Mini Secretariat in Poonch town, according to officials. They further informed that Chand was taken to the hospital where he was declared dead.

314.title: PCMC launches WhatsApp Chatbot to resolve public grievances in 6hrs
314.article_body: The Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) has launched 'WhatsApp Chatbot' to address the public grievances related to civic services like waste collection and sewage accumulation. Additional Municipal Commissioner Vikas Dhakane said the administration will try to resolve the complaints in six hours. Reportedly, PCMC resolved more than 500 complaints via WhatsApp Chatbot in a single day.

315.title: 27-yr-old man held for opening fire at a person at gym in Delhi
315.article_body: A 27-year-old man has been arrested for opening fire at a person at a gym in Delhi's Patel Nagar area, police said. The incident took place after the victim had an argument with the man's girlfriend a few days ago, police added. The victim received a gunshot injury in the stomach and was rushed to a hospital, police further said.

316.title: Tesla sells record-high 78,906 China-made vehicles in June
316.article_body: Tesla sold record-high 78,906 China-made vehicles in June, including 968 for export, the China Passenger Car Association said. The automaker sold 32,165 vehicles and exported 22,340 in May. The overall passenger car sales in China in June totalled 1.97 million, up 22% from a year earlier. Out of the total sales, electric cars accounted for 27%.

317.title: North Korean hackers targeting US hospitals with Maui ransomware: US
317.article_body: The US government agencies, in an advisory, said that North Korean government-sponsored cyber hackers have used a ransomware, known as Maui, since May 2021 to target US health organisations. According to cybersecurity firm Chainalysis, these hackers made at least $731 million in 2021. The advisory noted that the ransomware disrupted the healthcare services "for prolonged periods".

318.title: Deeply saddened by demise of former Japan PM Shinzo Abe: Rahul
318.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Friday expressed condolences and said that he's "deeply saddened" by the demise of former Japan PM Shinzo Abe. "[Abe's] role in strengthening...strategic relationship between India and Japan was commendable," he added. He further said that Abe has left behind a "lasting legacy in...Indo-Pacific". Abe died after being shot while delivering a speech in Nara city.

319.title: Even in Australia, spin will play big part in T20 WC 2022: Finch
319.article_body: Australia white-ball captain Aaron Finch has said that spin bowling will play a big part, especially in the middle overs, during this year's ICC T20 World Cup in Australia. "Spin is always going to have an impact...especially on bigger grounds in Australia. Here you have got to hit it in a way to get it to the boundary," Finch said.

320.title: Edtech platform Gurusiksha raises ₹50 lakh in its 1st funding round
320.article_body: Online tutoring and mentoring platform Gurusiksha has secured ₹50 lakh from angel investors in its first funding round. The startup plans to raise another funding round later this year. The newly-raised funds will be deployed for purposes like business expansion and adding more courses, the company said. Founded in 2016 by Dipak Jha, Gurusiksha claims to operate across India.

321.title: Bullet train project chief Satish Agnihotri fired over charges of corruption
321.article_body: The Railways has terminated the services of NHSRCL MD Satish Agnihotri, who was in charge of the government's bullet train project, following a Lokpal court order directing the CBI to probe corruption allegations against him. According to officials, there were several allegations against Agnihotri, including misuse of his official position and diverting funds illegally to a private company.

322.title: Delhi govt guarantees startup incubation for Business Blasters winners
322.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Friday tweeted that the Delhi government will be guaranteeing admission to colleges and incubation for startups to students who got successful in the Business Blasters initiative. Under the initiative, a total of 51,000 business ideas were proposed by around three lakh students from Classes 11 and 12, out of which 126 got investor funding.

323.title: NASA shares pic from world's biggest telescope, says 'Unexpected view of the universe'
323.article_body: NASA has shared a picture captured by the Fine Guidance Sensor (FGS) of the world's biggest telescope, James Webb Space Telescope. "Talk about an overachiever! Gaze at this test image...an unexpected & deep view of the universe," NASA wrote alongside the picture. NASA is expected to release the first full-colour images from the telescope next week.

324.title: Bullet that killed former Japan PM Shinzo Abe 'reached his heart': Doctors
324.article_body: The bullet that killed former Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe "reached his heart", doctors at Nara Medical University, who were treating him said in a news conference on Friday. Abe was bleeding profusely and doctors couldn't stop the bleeding, medical officials said. He was pronounced dead at 5:03 pm local time, officials added.

325.title: Water supply disrupted in Delhi due to high ammonia levels in Yamuna
325.article_body: Water supply was disrupted in parts of Delhi on Friday, due to a rise in ammonia levels in the Yamuna river, according to the Delhi Jal Board (DJB). Operations at the Wazirabad, Chandrawal and Okhla water treatment plants have been affected. Water supply will remain affected till the situation improves, the DJB had earlier said.

326.title: I shouldn't have been so greedy as an actor: Amar on quitting 'Kyunki...'
326.article_body: Amar Upadhyay said he quit TV show 'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi' as he had signed three movies. "When I left Kyunki, it was a hard decision," he added. Further, while regretting his decision, Amar said that he shouldn't have been so greedy as an actor. "Today, I would've stuck to Kyunki and told them to wait," Amar added.

327.title: Hardik surprised England's best batters, bossed 1st T20I totally: Jaffer
327.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer said Hardik Pandya, who became the first Indian to score a half-century and record a four-wicket haul in a T20I, during the first T20I against England "totally bossed" the match. "He hit that deck hard...bowled that channel which is hard to hit and surprised [England's best batters]," added Jaffer. Hardik smashed 51 runs off 33 balls.

328.title: 80-yr-old woman found dead with her throat slit in Delhi; probe on
328.article_body: An 80-year-old woman was found dead inside her house in Delhi's Shalimar Bagh area on Friday. DCP (Northwest district) Usha Rangnani said the woman was found lying on the bed with her throat partially slit. Rangnani said her ornaments and household articles were found intact, adding that prima facie, it appears the assailant had a friendly entry into the house.

329.title: Fatherhood is certainly life-changing: Nick Jonas on Malti Marie
329.article_body: Actress Priyanka Chopra's husband singer Nick Jonas recently spoke about his daughter Malti Marie, saying that she is amazing and brings him a lot of joy. He further said, "[Fatherhood] is certainly life-changing." Priyanka and Nick welcomed their daughter via surrogacy in January 2022. Malti Marie was born premature and had to spend over 100 days in the NICU.

330.title: Sanctions over Ukraine a declaration of economic war by West: Russia
330.article_body: The West's attempts to isolate Russia with sanctions are akin to a declaration of economic war, Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov said on Friday. Russia will now turn to China and India and other nations outside the West, he added. Notably, Ukraine and the West have termed Russia's invasion an imperial-style land grab.

331.title: I'll give equal importance to my batting, bowling: Hardik after 1st T20I win
331.article_body: Following his 4/33 and 51 in India's 50-run win against England in first T20I, India all-rounder Hardik Pandya said he'd give equal importance to his batting and bowling. "Bowling bit will take more credit because that spell brought us in the game...made it difficult for England to stay in the game," he added. Hardik was adjudged 'Player of the Match'.

332.title: Delhi court frames charges of rioting, attempt to murder against 3 in riots case
332.article_body: A Delhi court has framed charges of rioting, attempt to murder, unlawful assembly and dacoity against three persons in the 2020 Northeast Delhi riots case. The accused had allegedly attacked a Muslim man with a sword during the riots near Khajuri Khas. No case was made out for offence under IPC section 436 (arson), the court said.

333.title: If anybody can swing the ball in Aus, it'll be Bhuvneshwar: Giles on T20 WC
333.article_body: Talking about Bhuvneshwar Kumar who conceded 10 runs and dismissed Jos Buttler in the first T20I against England, ex-England spinner Ashley Giles said, "If anybody swings [the ball in Australia during T20 World Cup 2022] it'll be Bhuvi." "He has inked his name into [India's] World Cup squad already," added Giles. Bhuvneshwar had an economy rate of 3.33.

334.title: CM Eknath Shinde meets Maha Metro MD, reviews Pune Metro project
334.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Thursday reviewed the Pune Metro project work during a meeting with Maharashtra Metro Rail Corporation Limited's (Maha Metro) Managing Director Brijesh Dixit. CM Shinde was also informed about the current status of the 48.2-km phase two project report of Pune Metro. "The CM has assured...that Pune Metro project would get all possible assistance," Dixit said.

335.title: Cases of typhoid in Hyderabad on increase following monsoon
335.article_body: As monsoon has struck Hyderabad, the cases of typhoid are reportedly on a rise. Hospitals in the city have reported around 10-20 cases per week in the past two weeks. Most of these cases have been reported from Amberpet, Hafeezpet, Banjara Hills, Tolichowki and Mehdipatnam areas. "There's no outbreak of typhoid yet since cases are limited," a doctor said.

336.title: 2 killed, 48 injured as bus falls into 150-foot-deep gorge in J&K
336.article_body: Two persons were killed and 48 others were injured when a bus carrying a wedding procession fell into a 150-foot-deep gorge in Jammu and Kashmir's Udhampur district. "The bus hit a tree while rolling down the gorge, which reduced the impact and, perhaps, saved several lives," a police officer said. The injured persons are undergoing treatment at hospitals.

337.title: PM Modi shares pic from his most recent meeting with Japan's ex-PM Shinzo Abe
337.article_body: Following the demise of Japan's ex-PM Shinzo Abe after he was shot at, PM Narendra Modi shared a picture with him from their most recent meeting in Tokyo. "Always passionate about strengthening India-Japan ties, he had just taken over as...Chairman of...Japan-India Association," wrote PM Modi. One day national mourning has been announced on July 9 as a mark of respect.

338.title: Teachers' body criticises NCERT for removing chapters on climate change
338.article_body: Teachers Against the Climate Crisis (TACC) has criticised NCERT for removing certain chapters on climate change from the school syllabi. The removed portion includes chapters on the greenhouse effect, weather, climate, water, weather systems and Indian monsoon among others from syllabi of different classes. "We...are deeply dismayed by the many recent changes to school syllabi," TACC said.

339.title: Cong has misused Gandhi's name; brought country to a sorry state: CM Bommai
339.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai has accused Congress of misusing Mahatma Gandhi's name and bringing the country to a sorry state. "Congress is in the position of a convict. They bowed to lobbies...They do not have the moral right to preach to others," CM Bommai said. "There are more such scams which Congress has buried. They would be exposed," he added.

340.title: Shinzo Abe shooting is 5th gun attack on Japan politician since 1990: Report
340.article_body: Shooting of Japan's ex-PM Shinzo Abe is the fifth involving a politician of Japan since 1990, said NHK. In 1990, Motoshima Hitoshi, then-mayor of Nagasaki, was injured in an attack. In 1992 and 1994, attacks took place on then-LDP Vice President Kanemaru Shin and ex-PM Hosokawa Morihiro respectively, but both were unharmed. Nagasaki Mayor Ito Itcho was killed in 2007.

341.title: Indian startups' funding fell 33% to $6.9 bn in June quarter: Report
341.article_body: The total funding raised by Indian startups in the June quarter fell 33% to $6.9 billion in 409 funding rounds, Tracxn reported. The startups had raised $10.1 billion in the same quarter last year. The report added that 121 new startups closed their first funding rounds, four startups turned unicorns and 62 got acquired in the quarter.

342.title: PM Modi announces one day national mourning on July 9 as a mark of respect for Abe
342.article_body: After the demise of former Japan PM Shinzo Abe, Prime Minister Narendra Modi tweeted, "As a mark of our deepest respect for former Prime Minister Abe Shinzo, a one day national mourning shall be observed on 9 July 2022." "I am shocked and saddened beyond words at the tragic demise of one of my dearest friends, Shinzo Abe," he wrote.

343.title: Was unceremoniously dropped from 'Bombay...', my star value wasn't high: Ranveer
343.article_body: Ranveer Singh, during his appearance on 'Koffee with Karan season 7', said that he was "unceremoniously dropped" from 'Bombay Velvet'. "I was unceremoniously dropped because at the time I couldn't justify the budget. My star value wasn't high...But things have changed," he said. The lead role was eventually played by Ranbir Kapoor in the film, which was released in 2015.

344.title: Just wanted to share our joy: Ranbir on pregnancy being called 'promo stunt'
344.article_body: Speaking about his pregnancy announcement with his wife Alia Bhatt being called a "promotional stunt" for their upcoming film 'Brahmāstra', actor Ranbir Kapoor said that they just wanted to share their joy. "Alia and I as a married couple...felt it was the right time. We just wanted to share...the news and there was no other thought to it," he added.

345.title: Physiotherapist arrested for molesting female patient in Greater Noida clinic
345.article_body: A physiotherapist has been arrested for allegedly molesting a 20-year-old woman on the pretext of examining her at the former's clinic in Greater Noida, officials said. Officials added that the woman had gone to the clinic for consultation when the alleged incident took place. According to police, the woman had to run away from the clinic.

346.title: K'taka reports 1,053 new COVID-19 cases, 966 reported in B'luru
346.article_body: Karnataka on Thursday reported 1,053 new coronavirus cases, of which 966 cases were from Bengaluru alone, according to official data. However, the number of new cases recorded in both the state and the city was slightly less than the day before. The city's positivity rate was 4.96% and the number of active clusters was 22, the data revealed.

347.title: Batters were fearless, bowlers very clinical: Laxman on India's 1st T20I win
347.article_body: Praising India after their 50-run win against England in first T20I, VVS Laxman, who coached India, said the batters were fearless and bowlers very clinical. "Fabulous win last night! Proud of the way the boys approached the match right from the start and came out on top of it," he tweeted. India lead the three-match series 1-0.

348.title: Payal, Sangram perform puja at temple in Agra ahead of wedding
348.article_body: Actress Payal Rohatgi and wrestler Sangram Singh recently performed puja at a temple in Agra. The couple, who is set to tie the knot on July 9, visited Prachin Rajeshwar Mahadev Mandir to seek blessings. Payal's mehendi ceremony was held on July 6, pictures of which were shared by the actress on her Instagram handle.

349.title: Heavy rain increases water levels in 4 Pune dams by 1 TMC in 24hrs
