349.article_body: Following heavy rainfall, the water levels in four dams supplying water to Pune have increased by nearly one thousand million cubic feet (TMC) in the last 24 hours. The water storage in four dams Khadakwasla, Panshet, Varasgaon and Temghar has now reached 5.45 TMC. Last week, due to deficit rainfall, the storage in these dams had dropped to 2.5 TMC.

350.title: Rishi Sunak's wife brings tea to reporters waiting outside their home, pic surfaces
350.article_body: Rishi Sunak's wife Akshata Murty was seen serving tea and biscuits to journalists waiting outside their family home in London following Sunak's resignation as UK's Finance Minister. Murty is the daughter of Infosys' billionaire Founder NR Narayana Murthy. Notably, after the resignation of Boris Johnson, Sunak is said to be among the leaders in race to become the next PM.

351.title: BJP shouldn't teach Bengalis how to worship Goddess Kali: Moitra
351.article_body: TMC MP Mahua Moitra reacted to BJP criticising her remarks on Goddess Kali, saying that they "shouldn't teach Bengalis how to worship" the goddess. BJP should stop imposing its "version of Hinduism...based on established norms of North India" on other parts of India, she added. Earlier, Moitra said that to her, "Goddess Kali is a meat-eating and alcohol-accepting goddess."

352.title: 6 dead, 10 injured as bus crashes into truck in Tamil Nadu; PM expresses grief
352.article_body: Six persons died and over 10 others sustained injuries on Friday morning after the driver of the government bus in which they were travelling rammed into a stationary truck in Tamil Nadu's Chengalpattu district. Prime Minister Narendra Modi, while expressing grief over the loss of lives, said, "My thoughts are with those who have lost their loved ones."

353.title: 5 held in Brazil in $3 bn money laundering case involving crypto
353.article_body: Brazil's federal police carried out 'Operation Greed' on Thursday and arrested five people of a group believed to have laundered money made from illegal gold mining, Reuters reported. The group created its own crypto token and used other methods as well to launder funds, the police said. Over $3 billion moved through the group's bank accounts between 2019-21, it added.

354.title: Former Japan PM Shinzo Abe dies after being shot at during speech
354.article_body: Former Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe has died after being shot while delivering a speech in the city of Nara. Police said that the attacker, identified as 41-year-old Yamagami Tetsuya, told investigators that he was "dissatisfied" with Abe and "intended to kill him". The video of the attacker, who shot Abe from behind, had surfaced on social media.

355.title: Vivo India moves Delhi HC challenging freezing of bank accounts by ED
355.article_body: Vivo India on Friday approached the Delhi High Court challenging the freezing of its bank accounts by the Enforcement Directorate in connection with a money laundering case. "We have 9,000 employees. There is a liability," said advocate Siddharth Luthra. The ED seized 119 bank accounts of various entities with ₹465 crore including Vivo India's fixed deposits of around ₹66 crore.

356.title: Theranos' Pak-born executive Ramesh Balwani found guilty of fraud in US
356.article_body: Ramesh 'Sunny' Balwani, the former President of Theranos and ex-boyfriend of its Founder Elizabeth Holmes, has been found guilty of fraud in US. The Pakistan-born executive was convicted on two counts of conspiracy and 10 counts of fraud. Balwani and Holmes were accused of exaggerating the abilities of Theranos' machines. The startup was valued at $9 billion before its collapse.

357.title: Fintech startup Innoviti raises $45 million in Series D round
357.article_body: Fintech startup Innoviti Payment Solutions has raised $45 million in Series D funding round led by Singapore-based Panthera Growth Partners, which invested $15 million. Investments were also made by existing investors FMO and Bessemer Venture Partners as well as new investors like Alumni Ventures. The Bengaluru-based startup also raised debt from Trifecta Capital as part of the round.

358.title: We are world's 3rd largest startup ecosystem today: PM Modi
358.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, while addressing the Akhil Bhartiya Shiksha Samagam in Varanasi, stated that India is now the third-largest startup ecosystem in the world. "Not only did we recover so fast from the big epidemic of coronavirus, but today India is one of the fastest-growing large economies of the world," he added.

359.title: Rashmika to star opposite Tiger Shroff in his untitled next: Report
359.article_body: Actress Rashmika Mandanna will reportedly star opposite Tiger Shroff in his untitled next. "The team will be shooting in India as well as internationally," Pinkvilla quoted a source as saying. The film will be directed by Shashank Khaitan and produced by Karan Johar. It is expected to go on floors in the month of September, reports added.

360.title: BJP bags 102 of 130 panchayat seats unopposed in Arunachal Pradesh
360.article_body: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) has won 102 out of 130 seats unopposed in the gram panchayat elections in Arunachal Pradesh. Other 14 seats were bagged by Congress, National People's Party (NPP) and independent candidates. Chief Minister Pema Khandu thanked all BJP supporters on Twitter and said, "Congratulations and thanks to all karyakartas, supporters and sympathisers."

361.title: In a first, Gujarat to host 36th National Games in Sept: CM Patel
361.article_body: Gujarat CM Bhupendra Patel announced that they will be hosting the National Games for the first time this year. The western state will host the 36th edition between September 27 and October 10, CM Patel said. "Gujarat has been equipped with world-class sports infrastructure...[we] will leave no stone unturned to make the National Games best till date," he tweeted.

362.title: New players expressing themselves well; bench strength getting better: Pandya
362.article_body: India all-rounder Hardik Pandya has said that the new players who are coming into the Indian team are "expressing themselves really well". "The bench strength is getting better. The culture is changing," Pandya said. "They (management) have given us the freedom...Even if we get out playing a stroke, we never get a vibe after coming back," Pandya added.

363.title: CoinSwitch appoints ex-Flipkart exec as crypto Head of Engineering
363.article_body: CoinSwitch has appointed former Flipkart executive Sudheer Tumuluru as the crypto Head of Engineering. The news comes a day after CoinSwitch said three of its top executives and a senior blockchain engineer had left the company to start their own Web3 venture. Tumuluru, who served as a Director of Engineering at Flipkart, was also VP of Engineering at Myntra.

364.title: Former PayPal executive Jasmine Lee appointed Binance.US CFO
364.article_body: Binance.US, the US partner of world's largest crypto exchange Binance, appointed ex-PayPal Holdings executive Jasmine Lee as Chief Financial Officer (CFO) on Thursday. Lee has replaced interim CFO Eric Segal, who recently left the company after holding the role since October 2021. Jasmine had previously served as CFO and Chief Operating Officer for the Consumer Product Group at PayPal.

365.title: Deepak Hooda's performance will put pressure on Kohli: Wasim Jaffer
365.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer said India batter Deepak Hooda's performance in the first T20I against England will "put pressure" on Virat Kohli when he returns to the team for the second T20I. Hooda scored 33 runs off 17 balls in the first T20I. Hooda recently became the fourth Indian to smash a ton in the history of men's T20Is.

366.title: Pakistani cricketer Kamran Akmal's sacrificial goat gets stolen from his Lahore residence
366.article_body: One of the sacrificial goats Pakistani cricketer Kamran Akmal had bought for Eid ul Adha was stolen from outside his house in Lahore. Akmal’s father said that they had bought six goats to sacrifice a day ago and tied them outside their home. The theft reportedly took place at around 3 am.

367.title: Twitter fires 30% staff from its talent acquisition team amid deal with Musk
367.article_body: Months after announcing a hiring freeze, Twitter on Friday fired 30% of its talent acquisition team amid its $44 billion acquisition deal with Tesla CEO Elon Musk. A Twitter spokesperson confirmed these layoffs but did not share the exact number of affected employees. While these employees will receive severance packages, the company will "reprioritise" the remaining recruitment staff.

368.title: Karan Kundrra buys Jeep Wrangler Rubicon worth ₹60.35 lakh
368.article_body: Actor Karan Kundrra has bought a Jeep Wrangler Rubicon which is worth around ₹60.35 lakh. The actor recently shared the news with his fans and followers on his official YouTube channel. According to reports, Karan has one Range Rover Sport SVR, a Mini Cooper and an older generation of Ford Endeavour and a Ducati Diavel bike.

369.title: It didn't have the same control we saw for GT: Swann on Hardik's 51(33)
369.article_body: Ex-England cricketer Graeme Swann said Hardik Pandya's 51 off 33 balls in the first T20I against England didn't have the same control as visible in his knocks for GT during IPL 2022. Swann added this was because Hardik was taking his time while batting for GT. Hardik's 51 comprised six fours, a six. He had a strike rate of 154.54.

370.title: 1 student dies, 13 injured as tree uproots and falls on them at Chandigarh school
370.article_body: At least one student died and 13 got injured after a tree got uprooted and fell on them at Carmel Convent School in Chandigarh's Sector 9. Those injured were shifted to a hospital, ANI reported. Reportedly, the condition of a student and teacher is critical. The tree that fell was around 70 feet tall and 250 years old, reports added.

371.title: Parts of Bengaluru to face power cuts today and tomorrow
371.article_body: Parts of Bengaluru will face power outages today and tomorrow as BESCOM is carrying out maintenance and repair works. Most of these works will be done between 10 am and 5 pm. The areas that will be affected today include Navilu Nagar, Vinayaka Nagar etc. While the areas that will face power cuts tomorrow include Indira Nagar, KR Road etc.

372.title: India responds after China's statement on PM Modi's birthday greetings to Dalai Lama
372.article_body: India has responded after China's statement on PM Narendra Modi's birthday greetings to Dalai Lama. "It is a consistent policy of the government of India to treat His Holiness Dalai Lama as an honoured guest in India," government said. "His Holiness is accorded all due courtesies and freedom to conduct his religious and spiritual activities in India," the government added.

373.title: Wanted to make a movie like Jumanji, Indiana Jones: Sudeepa on Vikrant Rona
373.article_body: Kichcha Sudeepa, while speaking about his upcoming movie 'Vikrant Rona', said, "I insisted...we shoot everything indoor. We get the aesthetics right. No real locations." "I started thinking and feeling like we need to make a film like 'Jumanji'. We should have sets like 'Tarzan', 'Indiana Jones'. And nothing real-time can support you on that. You have to create," he added.

374.title: Crypto firm Celsius accused of fraud weeks after it froze users' assets
374.article_body: Celsius Network, which froze assets last month, used customer funds to rig the price of its crypto token and failed to hedge risk, a former money manager for the company has said. Celsius allegedly ran a Ponzi scheme to benefit itself through "gross mismanagement of customer deposits". The platform paused all transfers and withdrawals in June citing ''extreme market conditions''.

375.title: Heavy rainfall causes rock sliding in Pune; road cleared in 30 mins
375.article_body: A rock sliding incident took place near old Katraj tunnel in Pune as the city witnessed heavy rainfall. The road was cleared within 30 minutes with the help of a JCB machine, officials said. "There was a fear of the rock hitting vehicles...however, there were no casualties. Such an incident has occurred after two-three years," Dhankawadi Assistant Municipal Commissioner said.

376.title: No coercive action against TV anchor Ranjan: SC in Rahul Gandhi video case
376.article_body: The Supreme Court on Friday ordered "no coercive action of arrest" against TV anchor Rohit Ranjan in connection to multiple FIRs being filed against him after a misleading clip about Congress leader Rahul Gandhi was aired on his show. Ranjan approached the top court seeking an urgent hearing on his plea for protection from coercive action for the alleged offence.

377.title: 3 friends jump into canal to prove friendship in Faridabad; 1 rescued
377.article_body: Three drunk friends reportedly jumped into the Agra canal in Faridabad to prove their commitment to each other, police said on Thursday. While one of them has been rescued, other two are still missing. "All three of us jumped into canal one by one to prove how far we could go to prove our friendship," the rescued person told police.

378.title: Ons Jabeur becomes 1st Arab player, African woman to enter Grand Slam final
378.article_body: Women's tennis player Ons Jabeur has become the first Arab and Tunisian as well as the first African woman to enter a Grand Slam final after reaching the final of Wimbledon 2022. Jabeur defeated Tatjana Maria 6-2, 3-6, 6-1 in the semi-final. "I want to...inspire many more generations...We never believed...that we can do it, but...I'm trying to show...them," she said.

379.title: Bodies of 3 youths, aged 14-20, recovered from Yamuna in Delhi
379.article_body: Bodies of three youths, aged between 14 and 20 years, were retrieved from the Yamuna river in Burari, Delhi. The youths had come from Loni to take a bath before they drowned in the river, police said. The search operation is still underway as the body of the fourth youth is yet to be recovered, police added.

380.title: 18 held in Karnataka's Kerur after 3 stabbed during clashes, shops burnt
380.article_body: Karnataka's Bagalkote Police arrested 18 persons and registered four FIRs after three persons were stabbed in Kerur and shops were burnt. Clashes broke out between two groups after members of each side accused the other of harassing women. A Hindutva group leader accused Muslim men of eve-teasing a Hindu girl, police said. Large gatherings are banned till Friday in Kerur.

381.title: Johnny Depp donates earnings from NFT sale to charity associated with Amber Heard
381.article_body: Johnny Depp has donated the proceeds from an NFT sale to four charities, including the Children's Hospital Los Angeles, which has ties to Amber Heard. Depp's Never Fear Truth NFT (non-fungible token) platform announced that it had raised nearly $800,000. After the announcement, fans praised The Pirates of the Caribbean actor for his "never-ending kindness".

382.title: Mumbai woman cheated of ₹1 lakh while trying to claim birthday gift
382.article_body: An air hostess from Mumbai was cheated of ₹1 lakh while trying to claim her birthday gift from an online shopping company. According to police, the complainant had received a link by the courier service to claim her parcel. She then shared her bank details on the link following which ₹1 lakh was transferred from her account, police added.

383.title: SC grants interim bail to Alt News' Zubair in case against him in UP's Sitapur
383.article_body: Supreme Court on Friday granted interim bail to Alt News Co-founder Mohammad Zubair in the case registered against him in Sitapur, Uttar Pradesh. The court also issued notice to the UP police on Zubair's plea challenging Allahabad High Court order. The Allahabad High Court had dismissed petition moved by Zubair challenging FIR registered against him for a tweet.

384.title: In bid to implicate his grandfather, man kills 6-yr-old child in UP
384.article_body: A 20-year-old man was arrested after he allegedly murdered a six-year-old child in a bid to implicate his own grandfather who had stopped the accused from playing PUBG. During interrogation, the accused reportedly confessed that he kidnapped the child, sealed his lips with adhesive and strangled him to death. The deceased used to take tuition from the accused's grandfather.

385.title: Over 50% road accidents in last 6 months involved bikers: Cyberabad police
385.article_body: Nearly 58% of road accidents recorded over the last six months in Cyberabad involved those riding two-wheelers, Cyberabad Traffic Police said. Out of the 363 deaths reported since January 1 this year, 211 fatalities included those driving two-wheelers or riding pillion, the police added. Officials further noted that around 191 victims were riding the vehicle without a helmet.

386.title: Deeply shocked by attack on my friend Shinzo Abe: Manmohan Singh
386.article_body: Former PM Manmohan Singh on Friday reacted to former Japan PM Shinzo Abe being shot at during a speech in Nara city, saying, "Deeply shocked by the tragic attack on my friend [former Japan PM Abe]." "My prayers are with him and [his] family," Singh added. A 41-year-old man who reportedly shot Abe from behind has been arrested.

387.title: Outgoing US Secret Service Director to be Snap's security head
387.article_body: Snapchat-parent Snap has said that the outgoing US Secret Service Director James Murray will join the social media platform as its Chief Security Officer following his retirement from the service. Murray will start in his new role with Snap on August 1. He will be reporting directly to Chief Executive Officer Evan Spiegel.

388.title: Samantha in talks for Vicky's 'The Immortal Ashwatthama': Report
388.article_body: The makers of Vicky Kaushal starrer 'The Immortal Ashwatthama' have reportedly approached Samantha Ruth Prabhu for a role in the upcoming film. "Samantha has liked the world of Aditya (Dhar, director), however, the talks are still in a very advanced stage," Pinkvilla quoted a source as saying. The film will go on the floors in 2023, the report said.

389.title: Dismissed Punjab Health Minister Vijay Singla gets bail in corruption case
389.article_body: Punjab and Haryana High Court has granted bail to AAP leader and dismissed Punjab Health Minister Vijay Singla. He was arrested on May 24 by the state's Anti-Corruption Branch following corruption allegations against him and was removed from the state Cabinet. Singla was allegedly demanding a 1% commission from officials for contracts, Punjab Chief Minister's Office had said.

390.title: Happiness more important than any title: Nadal on pulling out of Wimbledon
390.article_body: Having pulled out of Wimbledon 2022 before his semi-final against Nick Kyrgios due to an abdominal tear, Rafael Nadal said, "The most important thing is happiness more than any title." "I can't risk that match and stay two, three months [out] of the competition," added Nadal. "I am very sad and [this has]...been a very tough [decision]," he stated.

391.title: Bairstow is on hot streak; overshadowing Root: Vaughan
391.article_body: Former England skipper Michael Vaughan has said that English batter Jonny Bairstow is on a "hot streak". "Bairstow is currently going through the type of hot streak that batters only go through once or twice in their career...I experienced it in 2002-03," Vaughan said. "He [Bairstow] is overshadowing the greatest England batter [Joe Root] that I've ever seen," Vaughan added.

392.title: Twitter tests 'CoTweets' feature to let users co-author tweets
392.article_body: Twitter has started testing a feature called 'CoTweets' that will allow users to co-author tweets. The company said that a co-authored tweet, for which a user will have to send an invite to another, will appear on both authors' profiles with both usernames and profile pictures in the header. The test currently involves selected accounts from Canada, Korea and US.

393.title: Red alert in Mumbai, Thane as IMD predicts very heavy rainfall for 2 days
393.article_body: India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a red alert in Mumbai and adjoining areas for Friday and Saturday. It has predicted 'heavy to very heavy rainfall' in Mumbai, Thane, Palghar, Raigad, Ratnagiri and Sindhudurg for today. Moreover, an orange alert is in place till July 12, which may change depending upon the rainfall received during the next two days.

394.title: Disneyland's FB, Instagram accounts briefly hacked, racist posts made
394.article_body: Disneyland Resort's Facebook and Instagram accounts were briefly hacked on Thursday, the company said. As per the screenshots shared online, a person claiming to be a "super hacker" posted a number of racist and homophobic posts on these accounts. "We worked quickly to remove the reprehensible content, secure our accounts and our security teams are conducting an investigation," Disneyland said.

395.title: India reports 18,815 new COVID-19 cases, 38 deaths; active cases rise to 1,22,335
395.article_body: India has reported 18,815 COVID-19 cases, 15,899 recoveries and 38 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 18,930 cases and 35 deaths. Notably, India's active COVID-19 cases jumped to 1,22,335, while the death toll reached 5,25,343.

396.title: Ford, VW-backed self-driving startup Argo AI fires 150 employees
396.article_body: Argo AI, a US-based startup which works on self-driving vehicle technology, has fired around 150 employees. "We are making prudent adjustments to our business plan to best continue on a path for success," the company said on the job cuts. The startup, backed by Ford Motor Company and Volkswagen AG, has a global workforce of more than 2,000 employees.

397.title: The ultra-wealthy choose experts, now so can you: dezerv.
397.article_body: Indian HNI's have been investing through experts for generations as they understand the importance of financial expertise for growing their money, said wealthtech dezerv. This defined dezerv.'s mission: to help all working professionals access such experts who create & optimize high-performing investment portfolios. You can focus on what you do best while experts help secure your future, it added.

398.title: Steve Smith sells his 4-BHK mansion in Sydney for ₹67 crore
398.article_body: Australia cricketer Steve Smith has sold his mansion in Sydney for AU$12.38 million (over ₹67 crore), almost double what he paid for the property little more than two years ago. As many as four parties had registered to bid on the four-bedroom, three-bathroom house, with bidding getting opened with an offer of AU$11.5 million.

399.title: Mahindra's EV unit to raise $250 mn from UK's BII at $9.1 bn valuation
399.article_body: Mahindra and Mahindra and British International Investment (BII) will each invest up to $250 million in a new EV subsidiary of Mahindra at a valuation of $9.1 billion. BII's investment will result in a 2.75% to 4.76% stake in the business. Mahindra's shares rose to as much as 5.4% to a record high on Friday.

400.title: Sara Ali Khan, Kartik Aaryan were dating each other, confirms Karan Johar
400.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar has confirmed that actors Sara Ali Khan and Kartik Aaryan were dating each other. Karan stated that Sara mentioned Kartik's name on his show 'Koffee with Karan' and they later started dating each other. "It's fantastic that this couch has actually manifested so many relationships!" Karan Johar said about his show.

401.title: CBI files FIR against Chitra, ex-Mumbai Police chief for tapping phones of NSE officials
401.article_body: The CBI has filed an FIR against former Mumbai Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey, former NSE head Ravi Narain and former NSE CEO Chitra Ramkrishna for alleged phone tapping of NSE employees during 2009-2017. It said that Isec Securities Pvt Ltd, a company incorporated by Pandey in March 2001, conducted illegal surveillance of NSE employees on orders of NSE chiefs.
